review:
! This review only refers to Steam Deck technical issues. To not be unfair, I rated "Recommended", as I can't say anything about the game(play) itself. 

I'm sorry, the game is unusable on Steam Deck, due to a weird mouse issue (mouse pointer movement restricted to 2/3 x 3/4 of screen width/height).

And it will only even run, using PROTON GE v8-32 or later. Plus setting an option in config dialogue window to "Run in window" (fullscreen, it won't even start).

Thus, I will have to refund. Unfortunately.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1705774275}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review: Incuriosita dal Made in Italy, mi sono approcciata per la prima volta ad un genere che non avevo mai considerato prima. E devo dire che l'azzardo √® stato vincente. Shadows on the Vatican ha tutto quello che un videogioco dovrebbe avere: una trama ben costruita, una meticolosa caratterizzazione dei personaggi, una dovizia di dettagli che non √® tanto usuale ritrovare nel gaming e una soundtrack fenomenale. Assolutamente promosso a pieni voti!

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198249119632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1678634447}
review:
Un gioco con luci ed ombre ma che alla fine si fa godere.
Ho sin da subito apprezzato la grafica curatissima in stile fumetto, che con le sue cutscene ricorda molto lo stile di XIII.
Anche il comparto audio √® ben realizzato, con delle musiche ben calate nell'atmosfera del gioco ed un doppiaggio sicuramente azzeccato per certi personaggi ma migliorabile per altri.
I dialoghi sono sensati e ben scritti e ho molto apprezzato certi stacchi ironici ( [spoiler] come il commento con relativo trofeo per il [i] bidet [/i] e certi dialoghi con Mario, il barista [/spoiler] )
E poi c'√® la trama, altra nota positiva del prodotto, cresce al giusto ritmo e prende senza fare troppi giri logici.

Ma, come dicevo inizialmente, ci sono anche delle note dolenti.
La pi√π grave fra queste √® che certe sezioni davvero non si fanno comprendere ( [spoiler] un esempio: nella sezione finale, prima dovremmo usare delle chiavi per agganciarci ad un'impalcatura, senza alcun motivo, e poi dovremmo coprire con un telo un comignolo, anche in questo caso totalmente random poich√© non si intende chiaramente che il volere del personaggio non √® entrare direttamente in casa bens√¨ far uscire da questa un personaggio chiave e solo dopo poter irrompere per commettere un furto... [/spoiler] ) o sono completamente arbitrarie ( [spoiler] come il minigioco dell'inseguimento con la macchina, in cui dovremmo scegliere delle strade su cui proseguire con il nostro veicolo, sperando di non incappare in ostacoli ma senza poterli minimamente prevedere in alcun modo [/spoiler] ).
Infine, sul lato tecnico c'√® da fare del labor limae: in diverse sezioni il gioco, nell'angolo superiore sinistro, visualizza un codice di errore [code] "Runtime Script Error, see Log for details" [/code]ed in pi√π i tempi di caricamento sono troppo lunghi per un'avventura cos√¨ leggera.

In soldoni, se cercate un'avventura semplice al punto giusto, con una bella grafica fumettosa e di durata breve, provate [b] Shadows on the Vatican Act I: Greed [/b]; vi intratterr√† sicuramente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150814810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1675313321}
review:
This is a review of Shadows on the Vatican Acts I and II, as I find them inseparable. This series has quickly become my game of the year, even playing it after so long, and right on time before the release of Act III.‚Ä®What does such a late release mean? This is not an indication of laziness. Quite the contrary: that can mean only one thing. This is a work of love, of passion, of huge investment in time and resources because this story WANTS to be told, and HAS to be experienced. This is a story beloved to the producers and storytellers, so much so that they have battled many an obstacle in these years to make it happen. This is a game that wants ITS VOICE to be heard.
As you load the game and the title screen appears, you are treated to one of most sublime game soundtracks I have ever heard. I mean Lara Croft‚Äôs theme in the original Tomb Raider level of epic. The music in Shadows is simply jaw dropping. I have the full OST in my playlist and I often listen to it, alongside Hans Zimmer, Dan Gibson, Carmina, Bach. You can find the full OST on Youtube as well (and I recommend listening to the track "To Silvia"). 
Let‚Äôs talk about the story and dialogues.
Inspired by the essay "In nome di Dio", Shadows on the Vatican is a thrill-filled story full of intrigue, mystery and some of the most deep and memorable characters I have ever met in a video game. James Murphy and Silvia are well rounded and beautifully designed ‚Äî seriously, the comics-style, hand drawn characters are heart-stopping beautiful ‚Äî and they have a deep personality. The plot will capture you and drag you through the two acts, leaving you wanting for more. There are tons of historical facts, trivia about Rome, the Vatican‚Ä¶ there is so much to learn!
One of the best parts of this game are the dialogues, the thoughts of the characters, their motivations, their shady past and uncertain future. Every character evolves through the story and I can‚Äôt wait to see where the next two acts will take us.
Puzzles and gameplay are classic, as one can expect from a point and click adventure game. There are inventory based puzzles, riddles, as well as some more difficult puzzles based on reading, numbers and deep thought. Some of them may be a tad too difficult, so don‚Äôt feel too bad if you have to check a walkthrough once or twice. It‚Äôs worth it! However, I also found some of the most fun, original and quirky puzzles as well, winking and giving a nod to typical cliches of point and click games and turning them around for the fun of it.
In this respect, there are TONS of easter eggs, funny achievements, references to the world of gaming, and to other games developed by other software houses.
In my opinion, the only reason why we don‚Äôt see a flood of overwhelmingly positive reviews is the fact that some players are reluctant to give it a chance before the four episodes come out. 
That is exactly the opposite of what we should do, as it is with our support NOW that can make a new act possible, that energies and budget can be allocated to the telling of this story.
Last but not least, let‚Äôs talk about the elephant in the room: the graphics. Not the comics-style drawings of the characters, but the 3D backgrounds and character models. Yes, the graphics is a bit rigid, and can feel outdated, even though it NEVER for a second bothered me or distracted me, and I actually find the backgrounds quite well detailed and well designed.
But we must keep this in mind: They were other times, there was no Kickstarter to bump up the budget of an indie company, there was no Steam to advertise, there was no indie trend, and the engines available were quite different.
I don‚Äôt want to hear it. Of course the graphics is a bit outdated. However, it shouldn‚Äôt affect or distract us too much, considering that we live in the era of masterpieces like Undertale and The Return of the Obra Dinn, purposefully reduced to bare bone graphics, for one reason or another. Whatever the case, we should be open-minded and accepting enough to give it a fair chance.
If you do it, you will be rewarded with amazing character designs, a jaw dropping soundtrack, memorable character, and a beautifully told story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071375554', 'num_games_owned': 2813, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1682562254}
review:
This is the first game of the series Shadows on the Vatican, you play as James, an ex-priest who became a doctor after an incident in the 90s. At the present time, he received a phone call from his friend Cristoforo who was asking for help, little did he know that there were secrets about the church he didn't know and must discover in order to help his friend. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2929519693

The gameplay is like any classic Point&Click. I liked the portraits of the characters and the artwork of the comic cutscenes, however, the characters looked dated during the gameplay. The areas and scenery look great though.

The dialogue and voiceovers are good in my opinion, although I've read in some of the reviews stating how bad it is. The puzzles are easy, and if you fail to do anything the game has autosave as well as manual save. You can explore the city with the fast-traveling map.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2929519870

When you first play the game, you'll hear an outstanding theme song on the menu screen, I liked it so much, and the developers are nice enough to put the soundtrack on steam for free, I would pay to listen to this music. The soundtracks of the game are really good.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2929522691

Pros:
+Interesting story.
+Excellent writing.
+Interesting characters
+Beautiful soundtracks. (Especially the main menu theme)
+Good puzzles.
+Manual save.
+Steam achievements.

Cons:
-The game is quite short, there is even an achievement where you can finish the game in less than two hours.
-Dated characters look.

Some of the achievements are missable, but there are some good guides here on steam to earn them all if you are into getting 100%.  I highly recommend it to people who enjoy P&C games and don't mind the religious aspects. P.S. Mario is my favorite character.

review:
Mais uma recomenda√ß√£o n√£o t√£o enf√°tica. 

A trama desse adventure tem potencial, mas como o jogo √© muito curtinho n√£o cheguei a empolgar totalmente. O plot twist do final foi bem clichez√£o e batido, mas eu gosto muito de hist√≥rias de conspira√ß√£o, ent√£o vou jogar os pr√≥ximos, at√© porque j√° est√£o na minha biblioteca hehe. 

Visualmente o jogo √© feio de doer, datado at√© para a √©poca do lan√ßamento. Eu me senti jogando algo do fim dos anos 90/in√≠cio dos 2000. Cen√°rios pr√©-renderizados pouco inspirados e personagens que se movem como rob√¥s. A arte em estilo comics que aparece em certos trechos do jogo tamb√©m n√£o √© sensacional. Trilha meh. 

Os puzzles s√£o, no geral, bem elaborados (ainda que com um ou outro elemento batido) e uma coisa positiva √© que n√£o √© um jogo que vai te puxando pela m√£ozinha e dizendo o que voc√™ tem que fazer ou para onde ir. Voc√™ tem que pensar.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995498126', 'num_games_owned': 2373, 'num_reviews': 668, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1653247813}
review:
Gut gemachtes Adventure.

Hat mir gut gefallen.
Ist auf jeden Fall was f√ºr jeden, der Kriminalgeschichten und Verschw√∂rungstheorien liebt.
Werde gleich danach mit Akt 2 von insgesamt 4 weitermachen.
Hoffentlich kommen die letzten beiden Akte auch noch auf den Markt, wegen Corona war jetzt viel Leerlaufzeit.
Daher w√§re es sch√∂n, wenn sich noch ein paar K√§ufer (im Sale) finden lassen w√ºrden, um das auch finanziell hinzubekommen.
Sehr sch√∂n ist, es gibt nicht nur Sammelkarten, sondern auch interessante Errungenschaften.
Wer sinnvolle Speicherst√§nde anlegt, kann die speziellen davon auch noch nachtr√§glich hinbekommen.
So muss man z.B. die Systemuhr auf Weihnachten stellen, und dann den Schornstein am Ende des Spiels benutzen.
Eins bekommt man nur, indem man in unter 2 Stunden erneut das Spiel durchspielt, ich habe 45 Minuten daf√ºr gebraucht, danach hatte ich den 100% Spielstand.
Da w√§re alternativ auch noch genug Zeit, um dann eine andere Errungenschaft mitzunehmen, die man nicht per Speicherstand schnell erreichen kann.
Es ist also eine noch akzeptable Mischung, damit auch ein kleiner Anspruch besteht.
Ich hatte einmal im Spiel einen Absturz, was aber auch an meiner 2 Monitorl√∂sung mit unterschiedlichen Aufl√∂sungen und dem hinausklicken f√ºrs nachlesen der n√§chsten Errungenschaften gelegen haben k√∂nnte.
Ansonsten war alles super und ich hatte viel Freude am Spiel, da die Story interessant und die R√§tsel nicht zu schwer waren.

Fazit: kaufen, kaufen, kaufen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198304856412', 'num_games_owned': 3250, 'num_reviews': 1570, 'playtime_forever': 1307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1307, 'last_played': 1684964202}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078495456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1651185639}
review:
Consigliatissimo primo episodio di una saga piacevole e ben fatta, che sa rispettare perfettamente i canoni del genere, senza abbandonarsi a frequenti citazioni stantie. 
Opera davvero di ottimo livello professionale, curata in maniera capillare nonostante figlia di una produzione indipendente. Intrattenitiva e mai frustrante, seria ma mai pesante. 
Personaggi e avvenimenti memorabili e credibili, buoni enigmi e musica ben realizzata. Buono il doppiaggio sia in italiano che in inglese.  Davvero buono, aspetto con ansia di poter proseguire la saga :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198007981462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1649543829}
review:
While a bit on the short side, this first act is a great setup for an investigation adventure involving thugs, the Vatican and money laundry. All characters are absolutely well defined with distinct personalities, something that you don't see very often. And there is the best side-kick character introduction ever seen in a P&C game.

Puzzles are generally well designed (with a few exceptions), but some of them really rely on the player examining every single hot spot with both left and right mouse buttons. 

Overall, I recommend this game to every one who likes investigative P&C games and conspiracies heavy stories.

review:

There are some rough areas like for example stiff character models and missing signposting at times, but i can overlook these as i am a sucker for such kind of point and clicks with conspiracies etc.

Keep it up guys, greetings to Italy from Greece.
developer_response: Thank you for your review! After Act II, don't forget to play Nightingale, a very important mini-episode linked to the series. Let us know what you think about it! :)

review:
Interesante propuesta indie que no ha acabado de engancharme. La forma de anticiparte la trama parece demasiado forzada o que te llega de sopet√≥n, as√≠ como algunos giros o introducciones de personajes. Los puzzles no me parecen para nada complicados y los subt√≠tulos en castellano tienen algunas faltas de ortograf√≠a bastante importantes.

Los gr√°ficos, si bien no es la parte m√°s importante, son bastante cutres y el juego no parece demasiado bien optimizado. El tema de que sea por cap√≠tulos, pues echar para atr√°s al quedarse la historia incompleta y no saber si terminar√°. La descripci√≥n de los personajes parece, por momentos, algo superficial, al destacar tanto que son muy atractivos (¬øes realmente necesario?).

En fin, no me ha acabado de enganchar lo suficiente, aunque le dar√© una oportunidad a la segunda parte ya que se juega f√°cil y su duraci√≥n no es demasiado larga. Logros f√°ciles de conseguir.

author: {'steamid': '76561199083925377', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1627429913}
review:
Visitando Roma de Chicago, onde trabalha como m√©dico, o ex-sacerdote James Murphy atende a um misterioso pedido de ajuda de seu amigo Cristoforo. O desaparecimento de uma pasta contendo documentos comprometedores convence James de que seu amigo √© v√≠tima de algo sinistro. O envolvimento do Vaticano inspira James a chegar ao fundo deste mist√©rio. Ao longo deste caminho perigoso e perturbador, James encontra o companheiro de viagem mais improv√°vel que questionar√° suas cren√ßas mais profundas. E assim os dois personagens come√ßam tanto uma jornada f√≠sica em busca da verdade, quanto uma explora√ß√£o metaf√≠sica da alma interior e dos segredos mais sombrios que todos escondem, at√© mesmo um "campe√£o da f√©" como James. Roma √© o palco desta aventura, uma cidade banhada pelo crep√∫sculo eterno, seus c√©us tingidos da cor do sangue derramado em mais de trinta anos de intriga: sangue de inocentes e culpados, de v√≠timas desconhecidas e famosas.
Este jogo possui uma boa trama, amei a hist√≥ria e a forma de como conseguiu mesclar a investiga√ß√£o com a religi√£o com enigma bem misterioso que quando descobrido se profunde numa √°rea sombria o que o faz querer saber mais da pr√≥xima sequ√™ncia. Curti demais os puzzles e o modo da conversa√ß√£o, possui um entretenimento bem legal e n√£o √© cansativo o jogo at√© o fim. Talvez o que possa o incomodar s√£o as movimenta√ß√µes do personagem andando, etc, mas n√£o chega a d√° vontade de parar de jogar (pelo amor de Deus). Os gr√°ficos, cen√°rios, principalmente a √°rea dos comic meio graphic novel que rola em uns momentos nos cen√°rios do jogo achei muito da hora.
Todos os personagens foram bem equilibrados e bem √∫teis para a hist√≥ria ao todo, os cut scenes com as tramas prende a aten√ß√£o desde o in√≠cio do jogo at√© ao fim do epis√≥dio e cada locais que podemos ir no jogo possui uma hist√≥ria por tr√°s sendo ela hist√≥rica ou n√£o mescla muito bem no que o jogo prop√¥s para o desenrolamento do enigma do Act I. Eu s√≥ sei que amei e recomendo muito ele, sendo uns dos meus favs agora.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078996445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 263, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1625103382}
review: Yet another incomplete, abandoned episodic game that died before there was much of any story development.  This first episode is a very short (there's an achievement for finishing in less than 2 hours that I got without even trying to especially) and very mediocre P&C adventure game in any case that hardly even gets the abandoned storyline started.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106507444', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1621565025}
review:
Lead voice actors are awful. Especially Silvia. She speaks too slowly in her voiceovers and is clearly reading her lines rather than acting them. She strikes me as the type who doesn't understand the difference between reading a scene and acting a scene. They probably told her over and over to put a bit of emotion into her acting but she figured since she was reading from a script, she should sound like she's reading. Godawful.

Puzzles in this game are mainly inventory puzzles, but very few of them make sense. Half the time I have no idea why I'm doing something. Hero is stuck hanging from a scaffold and he uses keys to pull himself up? Um, not only would that never work in real life, but it doesn't make any logical sense. The other annoyance is how linear the game is. You aren't allowed to do things unless the game decides it's time to do them. Hero will say over and over that something doesn't make sense until he finally decides it does. I spent the first hour listening to him refuse to do anything. Why would I do that? Um because I'm telling you to that's why!

 This game isn't exactly horrible. It just suffers from poor acting and illogical puzzles. Visually it looks great and the gameplay and controls are everything you'd want in an adventure game.  I've heard the second game is better. Here's hoping.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077336578', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1618305617}

author: {'steamid': '76561198989874805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1618116583}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025823574', 'num_games_owned': 3339, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1671892663}
review:
Shadows on the Vatican Act I: Greed is a short point and click adventure game - the game has an achievement for a sub-2 hour run (I made it to 50 minutes with mistakes), and Howlongtobeat lists the game as 2.5 hours long - it's not a major title.


First and foremost: 
- the game's animation is lacking

- the protagonist's (James') English voice acting is excellent for most of the game, but supporting character's VO is like a rollercoaster. Mario is great, the nun's mixed, Silvia's flat and it sounds like the voice actress just didn't even care.

- The story is loosely based on the 1984 book of  David A. Yallop:  In God's Name. It's like the first (few?) chapters of any Dan Brown book, but the programming is not so tight and there's surprisingly little gameplay/puzzle in the game.

I genuinely liked the game because it has character and I found it charming even with the silly animation style, and I found the story interested. So my review is positive, but as I mentioned the problems - it's not a flashed out and fancy game. Being at the current 68% review rate with mixed category is fitting for its overall quality, there are glaring issues that need to be overlooked to fully enjoy it.

review:
Loved this game. Same review for both Acts, being them part of a unique game.

Sviluppatori e tutta la combriccola che ha messo in piedi questo gioco assai scarso hanno molto da imparare sul modo di fare videogames senza discriminare fedi sportive o provenienze geografiche e devo imparare a fare storie coinvolgenti

author: {'steamid': '76561198050016554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1605761505}
review:
Je suis un peu emb√™t√© avec cet acte 1 de Shadows of Vatican. Je n'ai pas vraiment appr√©ci√© maiis l'acte 2 s'est r√©v√©l√© bien plus √† mon go√ªt. J'aurais tendance √† √©valuer n√©gativement le 1 et positivement le 2 mais le 2 √©tant √† peu pr√®s incompr√©hensible sans avoir fait le 1, √ßa n'a pas trop de sens de juger l'un sans l'autre. 
Bon, de quoi il retourne. On a affaire √† un point&click classique, du type je me ballade un peu partout en papotant et en ramassant des trucs. Cet acte 1 nous propose une intrigue bien men√©e mais somme toute banale et assez pr√©visible. Le personnage principal est sous-exploit√©. L'intro nous montre un traumatisme pass√© mais les f√™lures r√©sultantes du perso ne seront sensibles qu'√† l'acte 2. Les personnages secondaires de cet acte 1 ne sont pour la plupart pas partie prenante de l'intrigue. Le barman, la biblioth√©caire, la banqui√®re sont plus d√©di√©s au pittoresque et √† un humour bas√© sur une opposition de clich√©s "ritals" vs "ricains". Sur ce plan aussi, l'acte 2 est tr√®s diff√©rent avec des personnages importants pour l'intrigue.
Bref cet acte 1 n'est qu'une longue intro loin d'√™tre palpitante.
Personnellement j'ai trouv√© les encha√Ænements parfois peu fluides, par exemple devoir aller explicitement regarder un objet dans mon inventaire sans que √ßa ne dise rien de plus que quand je l'avais regard√© sur son √©tag√®re avant de le prendre ou re-rentrer dans un lieu dont j'ai tout √©puis√© pour d√©bloquer une cin√©matique, une action ou un dialogue. Encore un point qui m'a paru moins sensible dans l'acte 2.
Conclusion je vais finalement mettre un avis n√©gatif parce qu'au vu des dates de parution des actes 1 et 2 et l'√©tat du site officiel du jeu, j'ai bien l'impression que les actes 3 et 4 ne verront jamais le jour. L'acte 2 √† lui seul ne me sauve pas l'ensemble

review: Shadows on the Vatican is a good, all-around adventure game.  It is short, but well made.  New locations open up as you progress in the story. You find things, talk to people, using logic and problem solving to try and figure out who tried to kill your friend.  Surprise ending. Maybe the developers will make new chapters?

author: {'steamid': '76561198012473463', 'num_games_owned': 4077, 'num_reviews': 418, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1591752765}
review:
[h1]Follow our [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36214917/]Curator Group for more reviews[/url][/h1]
Shadows on the Vatican Act I: Greed is the first act of a planned 4 part series. It wound up only getting 2 games before being canceled, and honestly, it was for good reasons. This game has far too many flaws to get 3 sequels. Voice acting is the most obvious issue as it takes what was intended as an extremely serious story and makes it almost comical. Characters either sound wooden and emotionless or they sound like cartoonish caricatures. The plot itself isn't terrible, but is full of cliches. Within the first 5 minutes, a character calls you and says "something crazy has happened, I can't explain over the phone, come to my apartment quickly". It is such an obvious setup for a character death that you start to think he isn't dead because there's no way a professional writer could write something so bad. The point and click gameplay is generic and does little to alleviate any of the crushing boredom. One of the worst parts about trying to recommend this game is that even for the occasional person who likes this game, the story ends after 2 games, so you can't even get closure if you are a fan. Overall, just another poorly executed adventure game that isn't worth playing.

2/10
[quote]
Visit our [url=https://www.mmmreviews.com]website[/url] for more in-depth reviews and recommendations
[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198990784417', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1589651369}
review:
[h1] Verschw√∂rung im Vatikan [/h1]

[b] Geschichte: [/b]       
Wir spielen den Amerikaner James Murphy, einen Sch√∂nling der Arzt ist und zuvor als Priester t√§tig war. Sein ehemaliger Priesterkollege und Freund Christoforo bittet James um Hilfe, da er in Schwierigkeiten steckt. Im Vatican gehen scheinbar undurchsichtige Dinge vor sich. Hat Christoforo Entdeckungen gemacht, die f√ºr ihn besser unentdeckt geblieben w√§ren? Was spielt sich dort ab und wer sind die involvierten Personen, die dahinterstecken? Um was geht es, um Macht, um Geldw√§sche und hat sogar die Mafia ihre Finger im Spiel? James versucht diesem Mysterium auf den Grund zu gehen und seinem Freund zu helfen. Er f√§ngt an in Rom zu recherchieren... 

[b] Realer Hintergrund: [/b]       
Das Verm√∂gen der Vatikanbank IOR liegt sch√§tzungsweise bei mehreren Milliarden Euro. Rund um die Vatikanbank gab es schon so einige Skandale und den Verdacht auf Unregelm√§√üigkeiten. Das Institut wurde in der Vergangenheit wegen der mangelnden Transparenz seiner Bilanzen mit Geldw√§sche, Steuerhinterziehung, unsauberen Immobiliengesch√§ften und der Mafia in Verbindung gebracht. 1982 starb der Vorstand der Vatikanbank Roberto Calvi. Er wurde erh√§ngt an einer Br√ºcke aufgefunden. Ob es Selbstmord oder Mord war ist nicht ganz klar. Seitdem ranken sich Ger√ºchte um den Tod des Bankiers. Calvi wickelte wohl schmutzige Gesch√§fte f√ºr den Vatikan und die Mafia ab und starb vermutlich, weil er zu viel wusste. 

[b] Grafik und Ton: [/b]       
Warum wurde der teilweise ansprechende Comic-Stil nicht konsequent im ganzen Spiel umgesetzt? In den Zwischensequenzen gibt es einen Comic-Look. In Dialogen werden die Charaktere ebenfalls als Comic-Figuren dargestellt. Dieser restliche "2,5 D Look", mit den Hintergr√ºnden und Figuren wirkt einfach nur unpassend und h√§sslich. Die Figuren bewegen sich auch ganz seltsam steif und ungelenkig. Wenn eine Figur z.B. einen Gegenstand aufhebt, muss man ihr die Daumen dr√ºcken, dass sie sich dabei nicht die Knochen bricht. Dem Spiel h√§tte ein durchg√§ngiger Comic-Look wie z.B. bei Baphomets Fluch 1, 2 oder 5 deutlich besser gestanden. 

Es gibt eine englische Sprachausgabe und deutsche Untertitel. Die Untertitel sind soweit okay und weisen keine gro√üen Fehler auf. Die Musik bzw. der Soundtrack sind gut. Der Song beim Abspann gef√§llt mir. 

[b] R√§tseldesigne: [/b]       
Das R√§tseldesigne bietet mehr Schatten als Licht. Es wirkt teilweise sogar verungl√ºckt und nicht immer logisch. 

Eine sehr strikte Linearit√§t und teilweise sehr eingegrenzte Wahlm√∂glichkeit, wirken hier sogar st√∂rend. Man muss genau das, in der Reihenfolge erledigen, wie es die Entwickler vorgeben. Das f√ºhrt an manchen Stellen zu stumpfen ausprobieren aller M√∂glichkeiten. Egal wie logisch und sinnvoll das nun erscheint. Das geht deutlich besser. Entweder mit alternativen L√∂sungsm√∂glichkeiten, oder besseren Hinweisen und mehr Flexibilit√§t in welcher Reihenfolge eine Aufgabe / ein R√§tsel gel√∂st wird. 

Durch das suboptimale R√§tseldesigne und der starken Linearit√§t raubt man auch der Geschichte seine Dynamik und verhindert, dass mehr Spannung aufkommt. Durch eine geschicktere Erz√§hlweise k√∂nnte das Spiel durchaus Spannung erzeugen. Potential w√§re da gewesen. 

[b] Fazit: [/b]  
Es w√§re durchaus Potential f√ºr ein richtig gutes und unterhaltsames Adventure vorhanden gewesen. Wer √ºber die zuvor genannten M√§ngel hinwegsehen kann, sollte einen Blick riskieren. F√ºr mich ist es ein Durchschnitts-Adventure mit st√∂renden M√§ngeln, was ich in seiner jetzigen Version nicht empfehlen kann. 

[b] Bewertung:[/b]  57 %

Su apartado visual es tambi√©n muy bueno, si bien no he jugado demasiadas aventuras gr√°ficas hasta el momento, √©sta sin duda que es la que m√°s me gust√≥ en ese apartado, la banda sonora un poco por debajo pero aceptable. author: {'steamid': '76561198106512564', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1565482776}
review:
BottomLine at the Top:  A 3D 3rd person perspective P&C with decent art design and game play features, but also a story that I just couldn't get invested in.  Ultimately, it felt boring.  


-------------------------------------
Pros
-------------------------------------
-That main menu music is epic.  Reminds me of the menu from Phantasmagoria.
-Crisp art style with well-polished background/room design.  It‚Äôs kind of like a slick Gabriel Knight 3.
-Quality of life features: Double click run and fast travel to exit/enter new scene, autosaves, lots of save slots, spacebar highlight function.
-An interesting feature is the 3d directional audio in this game.  If your character is on one side of the screen his voice sounds like he is on that side and if he moves to the other the sound follows.  More noticeable on headphones.  It's a nice touch that gives a sense of immersion in the game.


-------------------------------------
Meh.
-------------------------------------
-Transition from dialogue to regaining mouse control is a second or two longer than I liked.
-Sprite animations are not graceful.  Things like picking up objects or sneaking around are awkward looking.
-There is an achievement called dialogue skipper that you get if you finish the game in less than 2 hours.  I found it kind of ironic as I did end up clicking through a lot of the dialogue because I just didn't find it enjoyable.  I wasn't sure if they thought a lot of people would be doing this or if they were actively encouraging people to skip dialogue but its strange either way. 


-------------------------------------
Cons
-------------------------------------
-Puzzles are non-intuitive.
-Main character isn't exactly a barrel of laughs.  Voice actor is decent, but I wasn't finding myself connecting with the character.  If you can't connect with the character you don't really get invested in the story.
-And the story.  It seems well researched, as it was inspired by a book written about a real-life church financial conspiracy.  But I just couldn‚Äôt get interested in it some reason.  The pacing felt to slow.  
-Car chase mini game is boring, long and unnecessary.  It has a decision tree with 11 choices that you must get right perfectly or else it restarts every time.  Should have come with a skip sequence as I was immediately not interested in trying to complete it.
-Silvia's voice acting at the end is atrocious.
-When in the final scene, I went to save my game it crashed, and I had to reload.


Interestingly I was playing this at the same time as Broken Sword I Director's Cut.  It was jarring to go from BSI to this game and back again.  This game, although similar in theme, is just so much ‚Äúheavier‚Äù.  An adventure game like this should be engaging with its DaVinci Code-esque church mystery conspiracy theme.  Instead it felt like work to get through.  I ended up going to other unplayed p&c games in my library which I think gives a pretty good indication as to how much I wanted to play through this story.  Reading through the other reviews it seems that there were more game breaking bugs but except for the last scene issue I described earlier it was mostly stable for me.  As it is a mostly stable game with good art design, quality of life features and an intuitive interface I would say that there is a good foundation for an enjoyable game here.  Ultimately though, the story pacing felt slow and I just could not connect with the main character.  
At $7 for 3 hours of game play, considering the issues listed above, this title is not worth it in my opinion.  However, it is currently 90% off.  At that price if you are a hardcore P&C gamer, I would say you can check it out and let me know what you think.  I received a review copy from the developer, and I would like to thank for giving me the opportunity to try out this title.  The second act has been out for a while now and they will soon be releasing the 3rd.  I am curious to see if the story picks up more in these subsequent entries but, after playing this first act, not so much that I am rushing to pick them up.

[hr][/hr]

This game is not worth even half euro. 
Game is broken. In the middle of the game I got an error:
Error loading texture: interface\info_mappa\Llocale1280.png
Out of memory! Execution can't continue.

I've got 32GB RAM!!! How much more this s...y game would need?

But... Even if it would work I would not recommend it, coz of:
- horrible animations
- time lost for neverending waiting
- gameplay style of Leisure Suit Larry I in 2k14

author: {'steamid': '76561198164016063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 333, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1563518564}
review:
pros

+ great looking pre rendered background graphics
+ when you click to space, hotspots is highlighted. No need to hunt for pixels.
+ interesting and some funny cast of characters
+ da vinci code type conspirancy story interesting
+ mostly enjoyable puzzles. there are also inventory puzzles you can combine some items
+ comic magazine style cut scenes looks good

cons

- low frame rate
- some bad voice acting
- slow gameplay
- slow animations
- too much loading screens
- game is short and episodic. it concluded with a cliff hanger.

overall this is an intriguing and fun to play point n click game but unfortunately game is episodic and first episode pretty short but i liked the game and i intend to buy and play another episodes too.

review: Un ottimo primo capitolo. Storia molto intrigante, dialoghi ben scritti e disegni davvero stupendi. Unica pecca, il 3D che non rende molto in una storia di questo tipo, ma non √® un problema. Le musiche sono ben curate, cos√¨ anche come l'atmosfera che si crea mentre si prosegue con le indagini. I personaggi sono ben delineati fin da subito, e non mancheranno attimi di tensioni e scenette comiche scritte con passione. Nel complesso, un ottimo gioco italiano (anche se consiglio di giocarlo in lingua inglese con i sottotitoli in italiano), vediamo come proceder√† la storia con l'Atto II !

author: {'steamid': '76561197992694498', 'num_games_owned': 2769, 'num_reviews': 450, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1555409791}
review:
[h1]Trashtastic game[/h1]

I don't usually write reviews for games i completely dislike, only when they're broken to the degree of unplayable to warn other people or they have potential and are good at its core. This game is goes nicely into a first option.

Gameplay is a traditional point&click but it feels clunky. Animations are slow and characters look really bad. Voice acting is bad too and sometimes the voice disappears. And there's a game breaking bug. When you reach a certain point in the story the game crashes and gives error about failing to load some .png. But this is not the "best" part yet. I've tried to change the graphics settings and see how it goes. It seems that when you put the game in windowed mode the saves disappear. When you put it back into fullscreen they reappear. Seriously what the fuck?! How on earth did they managed to do that? On top of all that after i've tried to solve the issue steam overlay disappeared. The game broken and unfinished.
I tried to run it the next day and it didn't crash anymore so i finished it. Nevertheless developers know about the bug because from steam discussions. i'm not the only one who encountered it and they still didn't look into this issue and let it solve by itself. 

I'm thinking what good to say about this game. And it's hard to think about a single good thing it has. Maybe story is not bad, but it's only act one and it ends on a cliffhanger.

It should be free or at least much cheaper and include both episodes for the same price.
Avoid this broken game, it's no good. It has some potential but to be enjoyable it should be completely redone.

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*]Story has some potential
[/list]
[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*]Terrible voiceacting
[*]Terrible graphics
[*]Annoying animations
[*]Long loading times
[*]Game breaking bug
[/list]

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32930811-Kosmos%27s-Cosmic-reviews/?appid=704030][h1]My curator page[/h1][/url]
developer_response:
Hi, 
we understand your frustration.
Anyway, let us point out a couple of details:

- the missing savegames are probably due to launching the SD version and not the HD. The "windowed" setting doesn't affect the savegames management. On the contrary, SD and HD versions are basically two different versions of the game, with incompatible savegames (engine limitation)

- we DID work on the game breaking bug you read about in the discussions. Before that, in case of memory exhaustion, the game became corrupted and yet allowed to save, which often left players stuck in a broken state. We changed that so that if there's not enough memory, now the game just terminates (with the error loading texture you mention). We added an auto-save system to prevent users wasting too much time replaying a long section of the game when trying again. As you experienced, trying again with different system load usually solves the issue. We know it's not perfect, but is what the budget allowed to do before switching all our development efforts on Act III. Hopefully in the future we will be able to come back again at Act I-II to further improve them and get rid of this problem for good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112272735', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1547917511}
review:
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33843777//] More interesting reviews on my Curator's Page[/url]

[i]When in Rome, make yourself at home![/i]

You play a former priest, currently Doctor James Murphy. The game starts with a flashback, during a charity mission to Africa, where our hero witnesses, for no apparent reason, the murder of his mentor, Bishop Dellerio. Presently, in Rome, you are urgently called by an ex-colleague priest and best friend, Cristoforo Ardemagni, who wishes to speak to you about what happened then. And from here onwards everything goes downhill fast! Your friend is found injured and is brought to hospital in a coma and you find yourself, without realising it, in a down spiral into hell: murder, fraud, conspiracy, in the spiritual and seemingly innocent meanders of the Vatican.

Taking place in Rome, this introductory episode is a quiet opening to a four-part story yet to be discovered. Its speed increases as the story evolves but remains quite unexciting until its cliff-hanger ending (now we‚Äôre talking!!).

Both settings and characters seem to jump out directly from a comic drawing board, pencil sketched and soft colouring. Beautifully drawn and very simple, the backgrounds depict quite well the heavy historical building-cluttered streets of Rome. Cutscenes, in graphic novel style, illustrate the progress of the story between gameplay.

 A pure point and click game, with a simple gameplay, free from convoluted tricks:  left click to pick, use or combine items and engage conversations; right click to describe items, surroundings, people.

In the English fully dubbed version, the voice-acting is acceptable, with some mishaps concerning the accents of characters who, supposedly, should be Italian and sound like north Americans.

For the aficionados of ‚Äúwhodunnit‚Äù and investigative mysteries, it‚Äôs a game worth playing. I certainly enjoyed playing it and that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm recommending it. However, it is still waiting for the full unravelling of the story: the first installment was released in 2012, the second in 2014 and the remaining  two are still to come. Though the developers are showing signs of some activity on Facebook (let‚Äôs hope it means good news), I strongly advise not to buy the game incomplete. It will only leave you frustrated and fidgety.

http://www.shadowsonthevatican.com/
https://www.facebook.com/pg/ShadowsOnTheVatican/posts/

Reviews:
https://adventuregamers.com/games/view/17290
http://www.gameboomers.com/reviews/Ss/ShadowsVatican/ShadowsVatican1.htm

author: {'steamid': '76561198111903675', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1546277322}
review:
Buona la prima per i ragazzi del 10th Art Studio.
Liberamente tratto da "In nome di Dio - La Morte di papa Luciani", il primo episodio delll'avventura prende forma nella Roma sede del Vaticano, procedendo tra intrighi, misteri, attentati ed inseguimenti.
La trama risulta plausibile ed omogenea, con dialoghi che riescono a mantenere il ritmo richiesto dall'ambientazione.
Gli intermezzi video resi a fumetto riescono a compendiare alcuni aspetti legnosi del motore grafco.
Tenuto conto dello sviluppo in pi√π episodi, la durata di circa 2-3 ore e pi√π che congrua.
Per quelli che utilizzano Linux, il gioco gira su Wine senza problemi.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970728391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1541901477}
review:
Strange game. Not usre if I know what is really going on. Lots of idle chit chat. Also, when you click on something, the character says what you are doing. An example is, when you turn on the stove to sterilize needle, he says that is what he is doing. After you are done, he says I should shut off the stove. Now I can put the needle with the thread. Not sure why it all has to be told to you like you are a 5 year old, but it does it all game long. Just a very confusing mess of what you are doing.

Graphically, game is ok. But the game looks really squared off. Almost every corner of a table, a wall, a book, etc., everything is perfectly square. The voice acting is fair and every location you go to is minimilized. Very little of that area is shown. The music is pretty good. It makes it sound like something is always about to happen, but it rarely does.

Found myself pretty bored with this game. Took me around 2 hours to beat.  Need sleep, play this for about 10 minutes and sleep tight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162381766', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 547, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1539163339}
review:
Questo primo atto, come durata √® piuttosto cortina, giusto 3 ore. Gli enigmi non son frustanti o illogici. Ma a volte le scelte di risolvere un enigma sono strane. Vedasi issarsi sull'impalcatura con un mazzo di chiavi. Graficamente √® ben fatto come sfondi e doppiaggio italiano, i modelli 3d invece stonano un p√≤ con lo sfondo. Cosa curiosa: Il gioco √® crashato appena son terminati i crediti rimandandomi al desktop. Anche la storia √® bella e complottistica al punto giusto, e finisce con un senso di curiosit√† nel sapere che succeder√† dopo. Anche la musica non √® male. Una delle pecche maggiori di questo gioco sono i caricamenti di una partita salvata, ci mette troppo tempo a caricare il salvataggio.

Quindi i pro di questo titolo sono:

- Storia
- Doppiaggio
- Sfondi.
- Musica 

i contro sono:

- I personaggi che stonano lievemente con lo sfondo.
- Enigmi in cui loro soluzione √® strana.
- Caricamento del salvataggio troppo lento. ^^;

Personalmente merita il prezzo pieno. Se per voi la poca durata di questo primo capitolo non vi da problemi. Altrimenti aspettate qualche sconto, ma in qualsiasi modo lo compriate, merita di essere giocato almeno per la storia. ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198012143442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1476435504}
review:
While I have seen the investigative mechanics and puzzels done better, the story still holds up and would make this a worth while buy for people interested in point and click storys.
That said: 
The last update on act 3 (out of 4) came 2015 and ever since it's silence or an ominous ";)" from a Dev in the forums, so while I am not saying that this game is dead, I will recommend to hold off on the buy until all 4 chapters are available just so you don't waste your money. What's there is fun with 2 likeable main characters, but it's only half the story - not selfcontained.

*EDIT* It seems like I missed a developer announcement via facebook regarding chapter 3. Work seems to continue, link below by Paggio, one of the Devs.

Do not buy until the rest is released. The recommendation would be a firm "Yes" if all chapters were out.
developer_response: Actually, there is a new update about Act III ---> https://www.facebook.com/ShadowsOnTheVatican/photos/a.552899781407399.1073741825.456166207747424/1998069370223759/

author: {'steamid': '76561198427374354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 783, 'last_played': 1526369638}
review: As far as Indie point & click adventures go, I'm usually happy to forgive their low-budget shortcomings, so long as there's a spark of creativity there to win me over.  Unfortunately, I could not find this spark in Shadows on the Vatican Act I. The story is uninteresting, the puzzles run-of-the-mill, the characters flat, and the voice acting amateurish. I don't plan to buy Act 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164717916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1591641549}

Makes all the mistakes for these games:
- too much dialog

It's also ridden with bugs, for added kicks.

Even for the low price, this is terrible. There are free games which are better than this.

review:
Sch√∂ner Auftakt, aber mit Makel.


Kirche und Verschw√∂rungen, ein Thema das immer wieder interessat ist, hat doch diese Institution viele Geheimnisse verborgen - auch heute - die nicht f√ºr die √ñffentlichkeit bestimmt sind... Meist geht es um das liebe Geld, worum geht es aber hier?

Wer ein klassisches Point and Click Adventure mag, wird hier ohne Frage gut bedient. DIe R√§tsel belaufen sich fast ausschlie√ülich aus Kombinieren und keine Schieber√§tsel versperren uns den Weg. Geschicktes, meist oder immer logisches Kombinieren bringt uns weiter, nur eine "Verfolgungsjagd" stellt sich, vor allem wenn man die Errungenschaft bekommen will als √§u√üerst fragw√ºrdig da...

Bugs sind mir keine aufgefallen, die HD-Version sieht logischerweise besser aus, als die verpixelte, auch da der Potagonist pl√∂tzlich h√§sslicher ist als die restlichen Umgebungsdetails oder Personen.

Die Spieldauer ist recht kurz, mit 2 mal durchspielen f√ºr die Errungenschaften rund 5 1/2 Stunden.

Und: Episodenformat, ohne Ende wenn es so bleibt... es gibt 2 Teile, der 3 und soweit ich wei√ü vorletzte Teil ist noch nicht erschienen und wird es auch eventuell nicht mehr... Schade!

Fazit:

Bedingt Empfehlenswert, auch wenn die Entwicklung vermutlich nicht abgeschlossen wird, was sehr schade ist! Wartet auf einen Sale!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046343516', 'num_games_owned': 2899, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1513169601}
review:
[h1]Von Priestern, Bankern und einer Killerin[/h1]

Im Juni 2014 erschien der 1. Teil des auf eine Quadrologie ausgelegten Point n‚Äôclick-Adventures ‚ÄûShadows on the Vatican‚Äú aus italienischem Hause, deren comichafter Stil mich interessierte und das lose auf einer literarischen Vorlage basiert (In nomine die, David Yallop). Man darf nur hoffen, dass die kaum existenten Hinweise auf die Umsetzung von Teil 3 und 4 ernst zu nehmen sind, um nicht erneut eine unvollendete Serienleiche zu haben (Teil 2 erschien Herbst 2015!). Also auf geht‚Äôs im 1. Teil [u]‚ÄûGier‚Äú[/u] nach Rom‚Ä¶

[b]Eine noch nie dagewesene Geschichte?[/b]
‚Ä¶von dem man aber kaum etwas Typisches zu Gesicht bekommt (wenn man von den oberfl√§chlichen Stereotypen Fu√üball, Essen und Grappa absieht). Wir spielen den Ex-Priester und Jetzt-Arzt James Murphy aus Chicago, der bei seinem Heimaturlaub in Rom u. a. seinen fr√ºheren Priesterkollegen Cristoforo besucht. Bereits bei dem Intro, das eine Kriegsszene in Afrika zeigt, bei dem James‚Äò fr√ºherer Mentor ermordet wurde, weist auf eine tiefer gr√ºndende Hintergrundgeschichte. Und schon bald wird Cristoforo schwer verletzt und man nimmt die Spur eines Komplotts auf, in dem die Bankgesch√§fte des Vatikans eine gro√üe Rolle spielen. 
Insgesamt also eine gem√§chliche Einf√ºhrung des Plots und der Figuren und eine wie man meinen w√ºrde, schon 1000 Mal erz√§hlte Verschw√∂rungsgeschichte um den Vatikan. Erst gegen Ende nimmt das Ganze richtig Fahrt auf, als man einer jungen Frau begegnet, deren Alter Ego wir f√ºr ein paar Minuten √ºbernehmen d√ºrfen, bevor der Killer-Cliffhanger kommt.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1239188801
[b]So traditionell wie der Vatikan selbst[/b]
Es handelt sich um ein klassisches Point n‚Äôclick-Spiel, dessen Bedienung mit Maus und Tastatur sehr leicht f√§llt, f√ºr Neulinge gibt es sogar ein Tutorial und eine Hotspotanzeige.
Auch die R√§tsel machen keine Ausnahme und erlauben und altbekannte, aber immerhin gut eingebundene Kost, bei der man ab und zu auch um die Ecke denken muss. V√∂llig unn√∂tig ist ein kleines Verfolgungsspiel, bei dem man an Kreuzungen per Zufall die richtige Abzweigung ausw√§hlen muss. Das basiert rein auf Gl√ºck (sofern ich nichts √ºbersehen habe) und ist einfach nur nervig. Dies f√§ngt das Speichersystem aber immerhin auf. 

[b]Alles lateinisch auf HD oder was?[/b]
Der Graphikstil innerhalb des Spiels ist nichts besonderes, comichaft und recht steril. Eher schwach sind die Animationen der Figuren, die zumindest bei mir sehr steif und hakelig waren. Dagegen sind die Zwischensequenzen positiv hervorzuheben, da sie comicstripartig eine sch√∂ne Atmosph√§re schaffen. Dieser hilft auch der gute Soundtrack, der eine tolle Untermalung bildet; v. a. der Creditsong hat es mir angetan.
Kommen wir zur Vertonung: Die Gespr√§che sind auf Englisch und Italienisch eingesprochen, Deutsch und andere Sprachen gibt‚Äôs als Untertitel mit ein paar am√ºsanten Fehlern (Faul statt Foul).

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1239188750
[b]Sonstiges[/b]
Seit einiger Zeit besitzt das Spiel 6 Sammelkarten, von den 20 Errungenschaften sind 75% beim ersten Spieldurchlauf zu erreichen. Die anderen sind etwas aberwitzig, so muss man etwa am 24.12. einen Schornstein benutzen‚Ä¶
Die Spielzeit bel√§uft sich auf 3-4 Stunden, was f√ºr knapp 6 ‚Ç¨ noch okay ist.

[code]Ein durchschnittlicher Vertreter seiner Zunft mit einer am Ende spannenden, aber doch recht gew√∂hnlichen Geschichte. Punkten kann der Soundtrack und zum Teil die R√§tsel, der Rest ist eher Normalkost. Da aber alles technisch einwandfrei lief und dies ja nur der Auftakt eines Vierteilers ist, gibt es einen Daumen schr√§g nach oben.[/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198032995265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1511661554}
review:
J'ai longuement h√©sit√© avant de me d√©cider pour l'un des pouces qui m'√©taient pr√©sent√©s... je vais m'essayer √† l'exercice de l'objectivit√© froide, bien qu'elle soit sans doute illusoire.

Le sc√©nario  :  pas mauvais en soi, on peut facilement √™tre assez curieux pour vouloir conna√Ætre la suite. Mais j'ai √©t√© g√™n√© par des passages qui manquaient vraiment de vraisemblances.

Les personnages : honn√™tement, le seul personnage qui semble avoir de l'√©paisseur apparait √† la toute fin. J'ai trouv√© les autres insipides, m√™me le "h√©ros" de l'intrigue. Souvent les personnages secondaires sont d'ailleurs des caricatures assez arch√©typales.

Les graphismes : sans doute pas le plus important sur ce type de jeu bien entendu. Les sc√®nes d√©coup√©es comme une BD entre les diff√©rentes actions m'ont plues, c'est un style, mais ce n'est pas envahissant et bien r√©alis√©. En revanche pour le reste... les animations des personnages manquent cruellement de naturel et l'ambiance n'y est pas... ce sont les sc√®nes "BD" qui sont les plus dynamiques...

Le "gameplay" : il est lourd, mais c'est l'apanage de ce type de jeu, ce serait un comble de se plaindre de longueurs. En revanche, j'ai trouv√© que les "solutions" n'√©taient pas si intuitives, elles ressemblent parfois trop √† une succession d'essais d'items entre eux ou d'interaction avec le d√©cor, parfois pas si logiques.

Les dialogues : inutilement bavards par moment, cela donne l'impression que tout a √©t√© mis√© sur eux pour mettre en oeuvre "l'ambiance". C'est bien sur normal, et m√™me important, qu'ils y participent mais leur faire endosser seul cette responsabilit√© ! D'autant qu'en r√©alit√© ils ne sont pas toujours tr√®s r√©ussis, certains tombent √† plat ou manquent de sens (certains dialogues du proprio par ex).

Pour conclure, il me semble que je ne peux recommander ce jeu. On pourra sans doute m'objecter qu'il prend une dimension sup√©rieure avec le 2√®me chapitre (d'autant qu'il est visiblement centr√© sur le personnage qui apparait √† la fin de ce premier opus) et que mon avis souffre d'une vison parcellaire de ce que peut offrir ce titre, mais dans tous les cas cette premi√®re partie ne m'a malheureusement pas suffisamment accroch√© pour que je me laisse convaincre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287475338', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1509890120}
review: Shadows on the Vatican Act I: Greed looks good. The 3D characters, both the model and various animations  look smooth and believable. When the characters speak they have their own half body portrait that will reflect their mood, which is very nice in this type of game. Different characters have accents for example Italian and American accents. The only problem is that it is extremely short, a little more than 2 hours. But it is still a very enjoyable game and it is like a prelude of what is to come in the second act, so I recommend it. Maybe get it on sale though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015003424', 'num_games_owned': 1489, 'num_reviews': 264, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1482620730}
review: If you are an avid adventure gamer, Shadows on the Vatican may be your cup of tea, even if it is a lukewarm one at best. For everyone else, there are probably much better games out there to get into the genre. The graphics are decent, but the voiceovers and writing are pretty bad and pretty corny, and the story in general feels too much like something out of The Da Vinci Code to be engaging.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990809098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1508503791}
review:
Lackluster in every way.
- Looks terrible. The car chase sequence is a joke. The cartoon panel cutscenes are not bad, but not great either.
- Sounds terrible. Some of the music is nice, but not varied enough. There is no sound design at all.
- The limited voice actors does nothing to save the abysmal script.
- The story isn't very compelling. It's set in Rome, but there are next to no references to the city geographically, and Vatican city is completely absent. Curious, considering the game's title.
- Most importantly, the puzzles themselves are completely uninteresting and don't require any creative thought besides some simple logic and a bit of pixel hunting. 
Even in the limited landscape of adventure games, stay away from this one.

In any case, there are better games on which to spend your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970662093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1488494820}
review:
Writing this review just to point out that the Key Features section of the store page for this game is almost entirely false. 

"...a thrilling new point-and-click adventure in 4 acts" [strike] False. There is no indication that parts three and four will ever be complete. [/strike] There is a hint that the remaining acts will follow, announced April 2022.
 
"Art direction by Lorenzo Ruggiero"  True, but a third tier inker with a bog standard resume seems like stretching the truth a bit too far in order to use the Marvel/DC credit.

"...with high resolution graphics and Full HD support" False.  Low quality models, backgrounds, etc., The HD version will not run on many systems and the developer's (paraphrased) solution is "Oh well, just run standard. The only difference is full HD backgrounds" meaning that "Full HD support" is an outright lie.

"Realistic characters with hours of motion-capture animations" False.  Awkward student-level character model design and laughable "motion capture."

"Well integrated puzzles..." False.

"Animated coloured comics..." False.  Zooming in and out and panning on a still image is hardly animation.

All told, you'll have a better time reading the wonderfully florid text of the store page.  The quality of writing here is far better than the in-game text and dialogues.  It was so well written, it convinced me to buy this below average, overly-ambitious game with all the red flags of a terrible adventure experience.

Komu polecam? / Komu odradzam?

author: {'steamid': '76561198308019923', 'num_games_owned': 1443, 'num_reviews': 265, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1486548190}
review:
Metto sconsigliato ma il gioco non √® totalmente negativo: semplicemente galleggia nel limbo della sufficienza/mediocrit√† e considerando le alternative dello stesso genere (avventure punta e clicca) si pu√≤ tranquillamente spendere i propri soldi altrove.
Tecnicamente il gioco non brilla: da una parte abbiamo un comparto grafico di certo non esaltante ma che stranamente si rivela relativamente esoso di risorse, dall'altra un sonoro caratterizzato da ottime musiche ma da un doppiaggio pessimo che ricorda i primissimi titoli localizzati nella nostra lingua (qualcuno ricorda il vecchio Nocturnal? "Chi ci difender√† dalle forze del maleeee" pronunciato con l'accento bolognese...).
La trama, considerando che si parla del primo episodio, √® poco giudicabile anche se le premesse non fanno pensare ad un capolavoro di originalit√†...

author: {'steamid': '76561198169199223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1486413873}
review:
Die Geschichte war schon ziemlich interessant und spannend, aber die Grafik...
Normalerweise ist mir das nicht so wichtig, aber hier war sie schon abartig schlecht. Einige Charaktere haben sich bewegt und mich angestarrt wie Epileptiker auf LSD. Ich hab schon 10 Jahre alte Spiele gespielt, die besser aussahen.
Wenn man sich ausschlie√ülich auf die kurzen, sch√∂nen Cutscenes konzentriert (es ist unglaublich Schade. W√§re das ganze Spiel in diesem gezeichneten Stil w√ºrde ich 10/10 Punkte vergeben.) und das restliches Spiel so wenig wie nur irgend m√∂glich anssieht, kann ich es eventuell empfehlen. Im Gesamtpaket - Nein! 
Ob ich mir den 2. Teil antue wei√ü ich noch nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019270397', 'num_games_owned': 4177, 'num_reviews': 733, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1486309111}
review:
Shadows on the Vatican est un bon thriller. L'acte 1 donne l'eau √† la bouche et on veut conna√Ætre la suite ! 

Les √©nigmes sont int√©ressantes, certaines sont d'ailleurs assez originales (j'ai beaucoup aim√© celle du livre et des images de saints). Elles forcent √† √™tre attentif et √† r√©fl√©chir, sans simplement faire de mani√®re fr√©n√©tique toutes les combinaisons d'objets.

Les dessins des personnages lors des dialogues sont bien faits, ainsi que les cin√©matiques qui font penser √† une bande-dessin√©e.

Par contre, il y a beaucoup de petits d√©fauts qui viennent g√¢cher l'exp√©rience de jeu :

- La mod√©lisation des personnages catastrophique : le h√©ros est raide comme un piquet avec une expression de visage abominable.
- Lorsqu'un objet ne peut pas √™tre utilis√© sur un autre √©l√©ment, une simple croix rouge interdit l'action. Dommage... √ßa rend la r√©solution des √©nigmes √† base d'objets trop facile.
- Dommage que le jeu ne nous laisse pas la main sur les recherches d'ordinateur...
- La course poursuite en voiture est p√©nible...

Mais malgr√© ces d√©fauts, je conseille ce jeu et m'attelle d√®s maintenant √† la suite... >> 14/20

review:

L'histoire est prenante, int√©ressante, riche et bien fichue. Les personnages sont travaill√©s et sympathiques. Les √©nigmes sont logiques bien que j'ai un peu buggu√© au d√©but, mais une fois qu'on a compris l'id√©e, √ßa roule tout seul.
Ca fait du bien de voir un jeu comme celui-l√†.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984170060', 'num_games_owned': 829, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1485079595}
review:
Tried twice but really struggled - the voice acting was really bad.  I've played games with bad VA before but the VA here was bad enough to put me off the game - at the very least the protagonist's VA should have been a bit better to balance out the rest of the cast.  

The point and click puzzles aren't too bad, insofar as it's just a matter of figuring out what to click next.

Despite getting it on a sale, still can't recommend it

author: {'steamid': '76561198103916275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1484494322}
review:
Grundsolide aber unspektakul√§r ‚Äì f√ºr Fans von Kirchenverschw√∂rungen

Mit dem ersten Akt zu ihrem Episodenspiel ‚ÄûShadows on the Vatican‚Äú liefern die italienischen Entwickler grundsolide Adventure-Kost auf Basis des klassischen Point & Click-Schemas. Fast schon ist man gewillt zu sagen, dass das Spiel zu solide sei, denn irgendwelche Besonderheiten, welche den Titel aus der Masse an Adventures hervorstechen lassen, sind kaum vorhanden. Ein netter Themesong und gef√§llige Comic-Zeichnungen alleine reichen heutzutage halt nicht mehr aus. Gr√∂√ütes Problem ist jedoch die mickrige Spielzeit in Kombination mit einem nach wie vor unvollst√§ndigen Gesamtprodukt, bei dem man noch nicht einmal sicher sein kann, ob die letzten beiden Akte √ºberhaupt noch fertiggestellt werden. Wem das nichts ausmacht, und der sich f√ºr die Thematik interessiert, der darf aber durchaus zugreifen. Spa√ü macht es ja durchaus, wenn man Point & Click-Adventures mag.


Pro und Kontra:

Pro:
- vern√ºnftiger Schwierigkeitsgrad, man kann das Spiel recht gut aus eigener Kraft bew√§ltigen
- gute Comic-Zeichnungen f√ºr Zwischensequenzen und Charakter-Portraits
- gelungener Themesong
- fieser Cliffhanger macht Lust auf mehr

Neutral:
- Standard Point & Click-Adventure-Gameplay ohne nennenswerte H√∂hen und Tiefen
- die Handlung in Akt I gelangt nicht √ºber Krimi-Standards hinaus

Kontra:
- sehr kurze Spielzeit von etwa 3 Stunden
- bemerkenswert minderwertige 3D-Charaktermodelle
- das witzlose Auto-Verfolgungsjagd-Ratespielchen h√§tte es echt nicht gebraucht


Das vollst√§ndige Review: http://www.gamecontrast.de/shadows-on-the-vatican-akt-i-gier-review/#more-61466

author: {'steamid': '76561198025674597', 'num_games_owned': 2061, 'num_reviews': 607, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1482554914}
review:
This is a pretty good point-and-click game, with an interesting story that revolves around mistery and secret plots. The writing is pretty good as well, and it keeps you hooked into the story, not to mention that the environments and the puzzles are well designed. Even as someone who doesn't play a lot of point-and-click games, I found most of the puzzles to be pretty intuitive; although I must admit there were certain instances in which I had to look for a guide, as I had no idea what to do. Still, that's got more to do with me not being used to this genre, than with the puzzles being too confusing; heck, there were a few times in which I had the right idea, but didn't know how to execute it.

Talking a bit more about the writing, the dialogue is pretty good and, despite its mostly serious tone, there's a few funny moments here and there, that actually manage to feel natural. Not to mention a couple of easter eggs hidden across the game.

Well, I don't know what more to say about this. It's a short game, and, as I mentioned, I'm not an expert on this genre, but it's still pretty good in my opinion. Also, I really want to see where the story goes next, as this is part of an episodic series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123831717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1484767227}
review:
Good game, nice scenario. 
Fells like you're in a movie.
Most of these kinds of games has less visuals and lets you imagine the scene, but in this game they made the scenes 3D and more visual.
If you like investigating, you can buy, it's worth what it costs.

In the other hand, it doesn't give you much opportunity to move arounds, most of the times you have to find what's the next step of the scenario and follow it. But since game has a nice scenario, that's okay.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995749658', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 1565, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1483434306}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970127820', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1483379734}
review:
Bueno, despu√©s de hace mucho tiempo sin jugar a ninguna aventura gr√°fica me decidido por empezar una y, vi que Shadows on the Vatican Act I: Greed y Act II estaban de oferta. As√≠ que empec√© por este primero.

La aventura en si est√° bien, es bastante f√°cil y se puede pasar en menos de dos horas, que por cierto hay un logro sobre esto mismo. Si lo completas en menos de dos horas lo activas. Tiene misterio y me ha dejado con la intriga de saber qu√© pasar√° con la aventura, as√≠ que me pondr√© con el Act II enseguida.

Decir que los di√°logos tienen bastantes faltas de ortograf√≠a y las frases no est√°n muy bien redactadas pero a√∫n as√≠ se aprecia el esfuerzo de haberla traducido, no como otros que no voy a mencionar. Tambi√©n tiene algunos bugs leves, como que los personajes, los cuales son en 3D, hacen movimientos extra√±os a veces y en verdad, estos personajes contrastan mucho con el entorno. Se agradece el 3D en im√°genes 2D pero casi hubiera preferido los personajes en 3D pero con aparencia de dibujado con el resto, para no contrastar tanto.

Tiene algunas cosas divertidas, como poder ver a "medias" el gol maradoniano de Maradona xD y otras cosas m√°s que mejor las pruebes por t√≠ mismo.

En res√∫men, para la gente que le gusten las aventuras gr√°ficas y quiera jugar una que no se alargue mucho,  os la recomiendo, seguramente acabar√©is jugando el Act II una vez completado el primero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041219230', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1472403345}
review:
Neat little adventure game. The backgrounds are always pretty spot on, and the dialogue flows nicely most of the time. The level of difficulty also worked for me. The model animation is clunky, yeah, but I can't really expect any better from a game that cost me nickels.

Obviously, it's only Act I of the entire series, so there's no proper conclusion to the game. It's unclear whether the devs will be able to churn out all the parts, but at least there's Act II available.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972822414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 412, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1473619094}
review: This is an uninspiring point and click game. For me the story flowed too slowly, you just seemed to be vaguely following clues with not enough exposition. This also made the puzzles disappointing as they just felt you were arbitrarily clicking things without knowing what you were trying to achieve. The 2D artwork is excellent which then contrasts with the poor 3D character models. So will I buy episode 2? Maybe, I‚Äôm really not sure, the plot does come together at the end which makes me curious to know what happens next but I‚Äôm not convinced based on the rest of this game. In the end I am giving this a thumbs up but only just, it is not a bad game but it sure isn‚Äôt a good game.

review:

Although it has an instersting story, the puzzels themselves are 'unfair' which makes it impossible to solve. Not going to test every item on every spot just to see what works. Still wondering how I was suppose to know that the bookmarks go with the calenders just to get the date of briths.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061041882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1468542483}
review: In short this game feels very rough. The animations are clunky and jerky as well as character models are not the best quality. The comic cut scenes, which I looked forward to most, are low res. Imo, the best thing in the game is the character portraits while talking (if you have that option on). The load screens are absolutely awful, long and drawn out. Especially when saving/loading. It feels extremely boring and unclear of what your next task is and it feels slow and almost pointless in how to progress. The game was lacking, the story seemed like it might have potential. Personally I'd rather just watch a walkthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021369844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1467568730}
review:
In the Shadows on the Vatican Act I: Greed you play as an ex-priest that aspires to be/is a doctor. Due to a sinful world you tragically lose your friend and your suspicion leads you to investigate his death which leads to a awesome cliffhanger that will get you excited for part 2.

This game is fun to play for as long as it lasts although all the talking can get a bit tedious and I started "fast" reading and thus skipping what I felt were useless conversations. There were no bugs while playing and the puzzles are alright although I did experience a little difficulty while finding the banks location. 

The most enjoyable elements of this game are the soundtracks and the cutscenes. I really enjoyed these, they used a good artstyle and the story was alright but maybe a bit predictable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004888674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1464004857}
review:
I was never big fan of point-n-click adventure games.
I just hate clicking on everything to find next clue.
Well Shadows on the Vatican is really nice game. I really enjoy it.

So why i don't recomend it? 
First of all it is short. And i mean [b]really short[/b]!
Second of all i hate cutting a game to so called "acts". I think it is a little scam to give 2 h of gameplay and you need to buy a rest.

As for visuals and music and the story it is really nice. Some dialoges are... naive at best but still this is nice game.

I would recomend this as a free game. As paid... well it is damn to short!

author: {'steamid': '76561198198711177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1663604923}
review: The game is very good. I enjoy playing it. It's about 4 hours to play. It's classic adventure game with logical puzzles. The puzzles are not too hard, but just hard enough. The ambient music is awsome,  I love music in the capena church. The actor voices are good enough. The story is great and good implemented with puzzles. You can read some books to know more about the story. The dialogs are good and classic written. I love the inventory. Its easy and functional. If you try to give something to someone and it's not correctly, then it appears red x in inventory, cool staff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052510862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1438125804}
review:
Faccio questa rece in concomitanza con la chiusura del secondo capitolo (appena recensito appunto)
Io mi sono divertito a giocare a questa avventura italiana. A tratti ben scritta e con personaggi credibili. Ve la consiglio assolutamente anche se ora √® leggermente datata.
Tre difetti per me principali:
1. i capelli del protagonista sono ingiustificabili e insensati.
2. la scirpa della roma dentro al bar ha scatenato fastiosi istinti dentro di me
3. il romanesco √® pessimo... ma questo anche nel 2

Enigmi ligici e contestualizzati. Storia avvincente. Bravi.
