review: I received the title for free from Indiegala and enjoyed it very much. It could be hard if you are new to the Point & Click games. The scenes look nice and the dialog was interesting and fun. The big downside of this game is the short 3 to 4 hour playtime. It left me curious about what happens in the next chapter but didn't had enough time to hook me for the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115158556', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 392, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1462245462}
review:
8/10 - A Sinister Plot Unravels In the Streets of Rome!

This game is spread out over (4) episodes. There are only (2) out at this time and this review only reflects the first offering. I was really impressed though; it reminded me of Face Noir and other classic and well-crafted Point and Click games. The story is quite original and the voice acting and atmosphere are really on point. The graphics are of good/moderate quality, but the way all the elements come together makes this game pretty special.

The story follows ex-priest James Murphy, a doctor on leave to visit a friend and former colleague. Things start to unfold when James receives a disturbing call from his friend about a potential conspiracy with the Vatican. Will you be able to solve the mystery and find out what lurks in the shadows?

My only complaint is the rate at which these games are coming out. The 2nd title came out (16) months after the first was released; although I did really like this game, that's a tremendous amount of time to wait for 3 hour installments. Based on this 16 month guesstimation; part 3 is due out February 2017! I really hope I remember to check it out...

It's worth the $7; an enjoyable, but short Point and Click. Easy to grab on sale!

review:
Un'avventura grafica molto piacevole da giocare

Punti di Forza:

- Una trama interessante ambientata a Roma 
(tema ecclesiastico)
- Gioco italiano
- Punta e clicca in stile classico con la possibilit√† di combinare gli oggetti 
(per alcune situazioni)
- Mario ci voleva
- Silvia ci voleva
- Un buon doppiaggio in italiano
- Ambienti realizzati molto bene
- Ottimi disegni in stile fumetto
- Bella colonna sonora del men√π principale

Punti di Debolezza:

- I modelli dei personaggi possono essere migliorati (gli ambienti sono fatti molto meglio)
- Gioco a episodi

Comprer√≤ sicuramente il seguito

author: {'steamid': '76561198042759221', 'num_games_owned': 856, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1450984370}
review:
If you're looking for a glorified visual novel, look no further.

Personally, I didn't find the storyline all that interesting and though there were some puzzles, a lot of it was just sitting around talking to people or being told where to go and what to do. I'd have liked a bit more freedom in playing or maybe even the opportunity to play a different character alongside the main one. While it's obvious you're going to follow a fairly religious gameplay since you control a former priest, the game really doesn't give you much freedom or choice with this. You're given options then immediately pushed towards the safer option, pretty much just giving you the illusion of choice and no real impact.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198017843065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1455057731}
review:
Slow, short, indie, point and click adventure.

Awkwardly drawn and executed. 'Story rich' in this case means long dialogues with almost amusingly bad voice acting, skipping is possible but not always instant. I lost interest in the story because it was so slowly delivered. Walking from point to point is slow too. The puzzles are few but not the most logical, trial and error will get you past some and a walk-through may be necessary for the less patient.

Quick and easy to 100%.

If you are a really big fan of the genre and need a cheap fix this game is often bundled and discounted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045154276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1451854828}
review:
Gioco completamente realizzato in Italia e non a caso ambientato a Roma, avventura grafica molto ben realizzata con tanti dialoghi stile fumetto. Il protagonista √® James Murphy, un ex-sacerdote e ora medico americano, che si ritrover√† ad indagare in loschi affari condotti dalla Banca Vaticana di cui, attraverso varie circostanze, rimane vittima un suo amico sacerdote, Cristoforo. 
Il gioco per essere completato richiede circa 5 ore.
Ho molto apprezzato questo gioco perch√® √® il classico esempio di come da giochi non "eccezionali" possano nascere dei piccoli capolavori.
Voto 70/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198141404871', 'num_games_owned': 910, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1450998660}
review:
Based loosely on the novel "In Nome di Dio" (In God's Name) by Dave Yallop published originally in 1997.  This is a four game series two of which have been released.  (Shadows of the Vatican Act 1: Greed and Shadows of the Vatican Act 2: Wrath)

Storyline: James Murphy left the priesthood in 1996 after the Vatican's investigation into his mentor's death was less then effective and the Vatican proved to be even less interested.  In present day he is a medical doctor in Chicago, IL (USA).  He has returned to Italy at the request of his friend Father Cristoforo who has urgent and vital information for him.  Before Cristoforo can impart this information to James, Cristoforo is nearly killed when he fell (or was pushed) down a flight of stairs.  In Act 1, James is trying to find out what Cristoforo wanted to tell him by following the clues Cristoforo left for him.  

Gameplay: Classic type point and game with a strong linear storyline.  The space bar brings up small magnifying glasses for search areas or areas of interest.  Since it is based on a book the storyline follows the plot of the book, and dialogue is essential to follow the story.  

Despite the 3D graphics most of the game has, the cutscenes are drawn comic book panels.  This in no way detracts from the gameplay and a simple picture or two progresses the gameplay quickly and concisely.  

There is only one actual puzzle, a maze more concisely, in this game.  It is a car chase! 

Mystery, intrique, greed, deception and quite possibly murder, what more could anyone want from a thriller?

review:
Catorce a√±os despu√©s de abandonar el sacerdocio, James Murphy retorna a Roma respondiendo a la misteriosa invitaci√≥n realizada por su amigo el Padre Cristoforo. Sea lo que fuera que deseaba contarle un desafortunado accidente lo impide. James sospecha enseguida que esto es m√°s de lo que parece. Sus pesquisas le llevar√°n a toparse con una conspiraci√≥n econ√≥mica en la que la Iglesia est√° metida y que puede costarle muy caro si decide continuar.

[b]Lo mejor.[/b] Original combinaci√≥n de gr√°ficos entre el 3D y la vi√±eta. Buena trama y banda sonora.

[b]Lo peor.[/b] La traducci√≥n de este Acto no acaba de ser correcta, pero que diantres, al menos est√° en espa√±ol. Falta carisma a los personajes. Que sea una entrega por cap√≠tulos dejando taaanto tiempo entre sus apariciones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038819876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1446206292}
review:
Shadows on the Vatican Act I: Greed is a game with potential. The story is decent and interesting enough to keep me playing, the sound and music are good, and the gameplay is what you would expect from point and click game. But what I really hate with it is the 3D animation for the characters, it's so stiff and awkward like it was made in early 90's. They should have stick with their comic cutscenes, it looks better.

Act 2 just been released and I think I will wait for it to go on sale or get the key for free somewhere later. The game is not bad overall, but I just don't like it much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078202213', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1537561947}
review:
Molto carino.

Trama: Siamo nei panni di un ex sacerdote tornato a Roma dopo anni per incontrare un nostro vecchio amico, Cristoforo. Cristoforo ci vuol vedere il prima possibile perch√© c'√® qualcosa di cui vuole parlarci ma noi non faremo in tempo. Prima d'incontrarlo gli capita un "incidente" e da qui si sviluppa l'inizio della vicenda.

Grafica e Sonoro: I disegni sono eccezionali. La grafica del gioco invece "gracchia". Disegni cos√¨ belli rendono ancora pi√π antiestetica la grafica del gioco. Comunque non si pu√≤ pretendere molto e il suo piccolo dovere lo fa'. Il sonoro √® davvero ottimo invece. 

Complessivamente: Personalmente lo consiglio. Non √® un gioco rivoluzionario, mi ha fatto comunque passare dei bei momenti. In parte mi ha fatto sorridere per le frasi un po' sciocche dei personaggi, a tratti riflettere e pensare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023996575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1442775358}
review:
"Shadows on the Vatican:  Act 1:  Greed" was meant to be the first entry in a series of four games.  Indications are the series was canned after the Italian release of Act 2, meaning that for most of the potential audience this is little more than a taster for a story that will never be completed.  That in itself may be enough reason to consider not buying it.  Speaking for myself -- I'm a massive adventure game fan.  Even with knowing that the series would not be going anywhere, I still bought the game and completed it.  (Honestly, because I feel like I need to play everything in the genre ...)

The controls are fairly standard -- right click to look, left click to interact and/or walk to a point on the screen.  

Graphics are mediocre;  the jerky, stiff animations are especially jarring.  There are comic book panels which probably looked good originally, but they were scanned at such a low resolution that they ended up fuzzy and requiring of a fair bit of concentration to make out their contents.

English-language voice acting ranges from good to very poor (everyone is voice acted -- and that will be important for some).  The main character sounds like Charlie Sheen, consider for yourself whether that is a plus or a minus.

Puzzles are varied and inventive.  However, although I would generally consider inventiveness in puzzle design a plus, it does require a slow build-up in order to acclimatise the player -- meaning using a certain gameplay dynamic in puzzles of ever-increasing complexity -- which is something this game doesn't do.  (In other words, some will probably be stumped early on.)

The storytelling feels similarly rushed:  there is next to no world building, meaning that everything you do is an action that serves to drive the plot forward;  adventure games tend to make use of menial tasks (as components of puzzles) in order to facilitate world building and immerse the player.  This game has very little in the way of menial tasks, aside from a short tutorial, which means that you'll be thrown into a series of locations and situations which were probably interesting in the writer/designer's mind but are boring in their presentation.  For example, take me to some ancient buildings, yes, but do something like the Broken Sword games and make me appreciate that I'm visiting an ancient building.  The game is set in Rome, for crying out loud.  Rome is an interesting place.  Show me Rome!  

In closing, regardless of whether I recommend this or not hardcore adventure gamers will probably buy it.  (As they should.)  For the rest, I don't see why anyone should be spending money on what is in essence the first quarter of a story that you'll never be able to finish.  The game is rather short too.  (And the poor achievement design means you'll need a guide to get 100% -- I guarantee you.)

Either way, in the name of fairness, I'm willing to alter this review to a recommendation should the missing Acts ever be completed and published on Steam.  For all its faults there's a lot of untapped potential here, and I'd love to see where this small but talented team of developers takes this series next (should they take it anywhere at all).

***

EDIT:

And here it is!  The second episode is out.

http://store.steampowered.com/app/378630/

I am surprised, but pleasantly so.  For the time being I'll leave this review as is.  Once I've played through Episode II, I plan on coming back and editing it accordingly.

That means it may become a positive or remain a negative, depending on how well Episode II builds on -- and improves on -- what has gone before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037920209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1206, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1661343186}
review:
[h1]A decent title. [/h1]
The first episode of [b]Shadows on the Vatican[/b] does not bears the signs of uniqueness, which were to bring a breath of freshness to the genre of point and click. However, Act I: Greed gives us a few hours of solid and pleasant entertainment. The observed defects are not so serious to want to prematurely remove the game from the disk or regret devoted to the completion time. The initial section in the successful style of Roman opens investigation into James Murphy, laying the foundation for a delicious whole. So if you like the novel by Dan Brown and other such stories, give a chance to the project by Italian developers. Really worth. Of course, provided that you do not set up on something revolutionary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132960300', 'num_games_owned': 1596, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1437905212}
review:
A normal Point&Click game, with a few puzzles (none of which are difficult), & an interesting story.

The story (no spoilers) was pretty good, & kept me interested the whole way through. 6/10.
The graphics were watchable & fine, but i believe below average. 4/10.
The sound was good, maybe even the 2nd best thing in the game, behind story. 6/10.

Overall, i really liked playing Shadows on the Vatican. I found the story to be quite solid, & i was into it almost straight away. It was very short (it took me 3hrs), but it was only Episode 1, so it's kind of like an intro to the story & characters.

En France, avec la r√©volution de 1789, les pr√™tres ont √©t√© tortur√©s, guillotin√©s, tu√©s et remis √† leur place. L‚ÄôEglise s‚Äôoccupe du spirituel et c‚Äôest tout. En Italie, l‚ÄôEglise a une place plus grande, trop grande et c‚Äôest ce que je n‚Äôaime pas.

Bon, je vous l‚Äôaccorde, je serais encore plus mal √† l‚Äôaise dans tous les pays o√π ce sont des religieux qui gouvernent, mais, l√† n‚Äôest pas la question.

Donc, je n‚Äôaime pas ce jeu.

Mais, si pour vous, cela n‚Äôa pas d‚Äôimportance, et bien, vous allez trouver ce jeu surement tr√®s bien surtout qu‚Äôil semble compos√© de 3 parties.

D‚Äôailleurs, √ßa me fait penser √† ¬´¬†Seven¬†¬ª un film sur un tueur en s√©rie autour des 7 p√©ch√©s capitaux.

Acheter ou pas acheter ? Moi, je regrette de l‚Äôavoir achet√©, pour vous, c‚Äôest √† vous de voir ...

[url=www.graal.fr/2015/06/30/test-shadows-on-the-vatican-la-version-pour-steam/]Pour d√©couvrir toutes mes impressions sur Shadows on the Vatican Acte I : Avarice.[/url]

review:

On the other hand I have to say that animations are sometimes annoying and poorly done,. But as you can see I recommend it, and I will play it again soon to hunt the few achievments I missed :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198028134305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1435422416}
review:
[b]*Act 1 has plenty of room for improvement; it provided me just enough build up and introduction to the story. Experienced point-and-click adventurers might not get enough satisfaction from this act. *[/b]

[h1]Story[/h1]
‚ÄòShadows on the Vatican‚Äô is a four-part episodic point-and-click adventure series. In its first act, Greed, you are taken back to 1996 when the protagonist, a priest of the Roman Catholic church named James Murphy, witnesses the murder of his mentor - Vatican priest named Dellerio - during a mission in Africa; which is told via reasonably looking comic-like cut scenes. James abandons his priesthood and moves from Italy back to his hometown of Chicago, where he becomes a doctor instead. Fourteen years later, James‚Äô receives an invitation to return to Rome at the request of his friend Cristoforo, who promises to have more information on what really happened in Africa. 

[h1]Voice-Acting[/h1]
The story initiates an investigation into a deadly conspiracy that spans continents and decades and perhaps involves some influential members of the Catholic Church.
The game, which was originally released back in 2012 in Italy, is now for sale on Steam. Act 1 is fully voice acted, but most of it is not very good. The voice acting is very hit or miss since several important characters sound American - not taking James into account - while the story takes place in the middle of Rome. 

[h1]Visual Style[/h1]
Another disappointing aspect is the extremely visually dated 3D character models. Moreover they do not feel the same as the rest of the game. Greed‚Äòs cut-scenes, menus, maps, character portraits, and inventory items are all hand-drawn - some better than others ‚Äì but somehow the developers 10th Art Studio and Adventure Productions decided to go with 3D character models and environments instead. Even the free HD-version of the game, which comes with the standard edition after purchase on Steam, does not make these models look even remotely acceptable. 

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Regarding the gameplay of this linear and simple build-up adventure, one can luckily be more positive. The developers have used the Wintermute Engine. The same engine that was used in similar games and results in a technically solid game because the engine has already been widely tested.
As one can expect from a mouse-driven game James can be moved around by clicking where you want him to go and you click on objects and people to interact with them, using the left and right mouse button each with its specific function. As seems common with modern point and click games, you can press the spacebar to show all the hotspots in the current scene for a few seconds. Moreover, the 'M' key should bring up the map of Rome, but this did not always work. Luckily many of the exits during scenes lead directly to the map.
Also the well-designed interface of the inventory makes it easy to collect, combine items and navigate. 

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
With an interesting cliffhanger as an ending of the first act, I‚Äôm curious to see what roles the different characters play in the story and how the mystery of the Vatican unfolds further. Act 1 has plenty of room for improvement; it provided me just enough build up and introduction to the story, in order to wait for the other episodes. However, experienced point-and-click players might not get enough satisfaction from this act. 
That being said, the game was initially published in 2012 and the second act is still not available on Steam. Developers claim they are fixing issues and adding extra features for the Steam-version, but multiple release dates have not been met, while ‚Äúthe latest deadline‚Äù was actually March 2015.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112696881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1438649833}
review:
Mi opinion sobre este juego es algo que no cambiaria aunque me mostraran pruebas.
Me ha gustado la historia de este, encima puede ser algo complicado para algunas personas que no se les den bien los acertijos, como en mi caso.

Tiene una historia muy agradable, es buena y me intriga, incluso he buscado la segunda parte.
Soy una persona la cual normalmente no juega este tipo de videojuegos, pero ha sido una excepcion para mi.

Mi Laptop lo ha corrido sin problemas, se me ha apagado de vez en cuando jugando (Pero en realidad era porque mi Laptop se sobrecalentaba y no tiene un buen enfriador), incluso cabe decir que lo hacia cuando aun no guardaba la partida... Hahahaha.

Lo recomiendo bastante si eres una persona la cual le gusta resolver algunos misterios por asi decirlo, y tambien si te gusta romperte la cabeza haha.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151222668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1435203472}
review:
This is my review of this game please note that I got this free from IndieGala.

Graphics: Beautiful, very nice HD graphics for a game like this. I was very impressed. 8/10

Gameplay: Click and touch. Requires intelligence and logic to keep playing. The plot was not as boring as other people said so, it was interesting for me to continue playing. However I had to refer to YouTube for walkthrough hints when I got stuck a couple of times because this game has no hints-you have to try all the possiblities like mix and matching the differnent items in your inventory with one another and also with the environment. Dialogue wise voice acting was superb for a game like this but some conversations are rather obnoxious and I had to skip it. 5.5/10

Thats all for this review I rate it 6.7/10. Worth buying when on sale. I learnt a lot on Italian history and their language when playing this. This game is based in Rome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025788133', 'num_games_owned': 647, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1433622249}
review:
For a guy who doesn't play many Point & Click games, this game really took me by surprise. I found that the game was quite fresh for a person like me, who prefers a good Strategy over P&C adventure games. The game puts you, James, into a puzzle filled quest as you strive to find out clues as to why your coma induced friend is leaving you clues. 

This game is easy to complete, I did it in roughly 1.5 hours. So for a short space of time, it is an excellent time killer, also the game was free anyway, so for a free game it isn't that bad in all honesty. The only negative aspect of this game is that the character walks too slow, but then again, that is tradition with Adventure games such as Monkey Island & Broken Sword. 

Overall, 8/10, no Catholic Priests touched me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104350057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1433016971}
review:
I got stucked very quickly. Why can't I get the keys???

Anyway, it is a game I will only play if my book of Harry Potter is more boring then Rupert.

At least I got my cards very quickly. That's a pro.

Graphics are boring, the sound (backgroundmusic) is good. Voices, well some are ok. BUT if I would meet that nun in real life, I def would run away. I can NOT stand that voice.

It is a point and click game, I was hoping it was more fun, and less confusing. HOW DO I GET THOSE DAMNED KEYS?!?!?!
BUT even if I am able to get the keys from the nun, I probably prefer to read my Harry Twatter book. I think I might throw this game away in my recycle bin, at least it saves me some space on my harddrive.

4/10, if you get this game as a gift, give it back please.

review:
Titolo controverso.
Nonostante le stanze siano ben fatte e strutturate, i personaggi discretamente caratterizzati e la storia abbastanza coinvolgente, il gioco risulta molto limitato.
Le interazioni con l'ambiente e gli oggetti risulta ridotta ai minimi termini, il doppiaggio √® stato preso troppo sotto gamba e la longevit√† non raggiunge la sufficienza (va bene, √® solo un capitolo della serie ma sarebbe stato preferibile un gioco completo). A peggiorare la situazione si aggiunge la violazione di almeno 2 delle 10 regole di Gilbert (che non sono la bibbia, ma i 10 comandamenti).

Insomma: enormi potenzialit√† sfruttate enormemente male.

Da appassionato del genere non mi sento di consigliarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154757644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1431903473}
review:
Interesting while it lasts...

This is a very short prologue of an adventure. The three and a half hours it took me to complete it served to build up a tense atmosphere that began to draw me into the plot. Sadly however, it ended abruptly and very frustratingly, with nothing resolved.

I am not sure about these episodic adventures. On the one hand, it is understandable that developers need to release titles in parts as they need the finance to finish off the game, but on the other hand it can be very frustrating for the player that enjoys the full works. I guess this has to do with the generally low price of retail nowadays, compared to, say 15 - 20 years ago when full, long games cost at least 10 times as much. So it's not surprising short episodic chunks are being brought to us.

The graphics are good and easily serve the purpose, creating a solid atmosphere. The dialogue and voice work is very well done. The main character is particularly well-voiced. The puzzles are mostly very easy as everything points the player in the right direction. The only time I had any length of difficulty (and it wasn't very long) was in a pixel puzzle where something needed to be picked up to move the story along.

I notice that the second episode came out two years after this one. There are supposed to be 4 episodes in all, so it looks like this game won't be concluded for another 4 years, if the developers keep at it. Thus, I'm going to sit it out and wait for the rest to be released before I play anymore.

review: I really enjoyed this game. The art style is pretty cool the story has some plot twists and i'll be honest the length of the game is some what of an issue for me its only around 3 hours. But for 7 dollars I really can't complain my only wish is that the rest of the saga "Shadows on the Vatican" gets greenlit because im curious on how the story continues to unfold. I'll be honest some of the puzzles in the game I wasn't sure about it could be I wasn't paying much attention or the information wasn't there but I did have to look up a guide for certain sections of this game. Overall I would recommend this game to anyone who likes stories about corruption and puzzle games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022458781', 'num_games_owned': 2808, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1427559033}
review:
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/40165899]Curatore in lingua italiana[/url]

Shadows of the Vatican √® una avventura in terza persona pianificata originariamente per far parte di una serie, di cui sarebbe stata la capostipite: attualmente per√≤ ne sono state pubblicate in totale solo due. Vediamo un po' di caratteristiche. Gli ambienti ed i personaggi sono ben resi graficamente, anche se non ci sono primi piani ed animazioni facciali; inoltre noto un numero non sufficiente di frame di animazione. Molto suggestive le scene di intermezzo, nelle quali la grafica muta di punto in bianco verso soluzioni di tipo disegno fumettistico. Il sonoro √® buono, ed √® interessante che la colonna sonora di sottofondo del menu, di sapore corale sacro medioevale, venga invece ripresentata nei titoli di coda in versione pi√π moderna e decisamente rock.  La trama √® tinta di sfumature noir, feroce, che non lesina crude scene di assassinio. Le voci sono di qualit√† ed inquadrate nella parte. Gli enigmi non sono affatto facili. Dal mio punto di vista personale esprimo un vivo apprezzamento del fatto che, dopo tutte quelle adventure americane, inglesi, francesi, ecc., ce ne sia una finalmente ambientata nel Bel Paese, e che in essa si respiri finalmente l'aria di casa nostra, con personaggi squisitamente nostrani e con una citt√† di Roma che, come palcoscenico di storie e personaggi, oltre che per altri aspetti, nulla ha da invidiare a quella di New York, Parigi o Londra (senza nulla togliere alla qualit√† delle avventure straniere, sia chiaro). La cosa che invece mi ha dato pi√π fastidio √® che, mentre mi sembrava che si entrasse nel vivo del gioco, esso invece termina: in un Gabriel Knight Sin of the Fathers , per es., le battute di gioco di SotV avrebbero coperto solo il primo giorno..  Ma d'altronde dalla pubblicit√† del gioco si evince la brevit√† del gioco, ed inoltre il suo prezzo di copertina non √® elevato, vista anche la sua qualit√†. Un altro neo √® che sia i caricamenti che i salvataggi non mi sembrano proprio veloci. In definitiva consiglio questo gioco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130262111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1590083959}
review:
El juego esta muy bien, es una aventura grafica muy entretenida. Me recuerda a la saga Broken Sword. Lo unico que hecho en falta, es que sea un poco mas larga la aventura y que este doblado al castellano, pero al menos esta traducido.
El precio me parecio un poco excesivo, ademas, me hubiese gustado haber tenido que comprar el juego en Gog o Fx Interactive, haber si lo sacan para esas tiendaa interactivas.
Si te gustan las aventuras graficas, este juego sin duda es de los tuyos.
Espero que pronto saquen la segunda entrega en Steam y no se hagan de rogar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042831386', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 627, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1422885131}
review:
[h1]Short version: 77%[/h1]
Shadows on the Vatican is a typical European thriller in an adventure game format. With a good plot, acceptable dialogues and painful English voice acting. If this wouldn‚Äôt be only the first quarter of a seemingly defunct miniseries, I would wholeheartedly recommend it for anyone.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
As the title suggests, Shadows on the Vatican ‚Äì Act I: Greed is the first part of a point ‚Äòn‚Äô click adventure game miniseries. That, surprisingly, was made by Italians.
Surprisingly, since the plot‚Äì a thriller set around a financial crime‚Äì, the characters, and the art style all point to French bande dessine√©s (comic albums, where these kinds of stories are quite frequent), not Italian fumettis.

Not that it matters, since what we get is a solid work, although not without flaws. For example the English voiceover is barely tolerable at best. Also, since this is only a quarter of a story, it is quite short and doesn‚Äôt answer any questions, only sets up further episodes. And those may never be published at all: when this review was written, only Act II was available from the publisher‚Äôs web site.

Still, if you don‚Äôt mind watching only the beginning of a thriller and have 2-3 spare hours, this game is an enjoyable way to pass the time.

review:
Investigational and point & click game?I don't usually play neither of those 2 categories but this one was surprisingly interesting and entertainment.

and it's an indie game.

Like how the story line evolves everytime that you solve a case or you find a clue,it gives you imputs to go on with the game and see what's next,that's why whoever has finished this game without watching walkthroughts or reading guides like me it had that moments in wich you didn't know where to go,who to talk with or wich items to use or to combine between them and that ended everytime on moving the mouse on every millimeter of the monitor to see if you missed something important(for example that time when i just had to pick the cigar fron the ground but i didn't see it at first).

Pro:

-Enjoinable story line
-good enigmas
-ok characters
-decent grafics,at least for an indipendent game i think it's fine
-liked the acting voices
-you have to acctualy use your brain and have patience(some people would simply prefer something with faster immersion like call of duty)
-it's cheap

contra:

-charachers movement makes you smile 
-it has a stupid achievement in wich you have to finish the game in less that 2 hours,but this means to skip all the cut scenes and it's stupid cause whoever has created the achievement, also developed the game
-at the end Mario didn't fix the tv

author: {'steamid': '76561198067758630', 'num_games_owned': 665, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1424722174}
review:
[h1]Shadows on the Vatican Act I: Greed[/h1]

Shadows on the Vatican Act I √© um jogo de Point'n Click sobre um Ex-Padre (James Murphy) que foi para Roma onde atende uma chamada "misteriosa" e tem de ajudar seu amigo. O jogo tem alguns puzzles dif√≠ceis e outros f√°ceis, voc√™ pode combinar itens e transforma-lo em um, pode inspecionar itens (tanto no ch√£o quanto em seu invent√°rio) e pode usalos em alguem ou em algo. 
Uma das coisas que eu n√£o gostei foi o movimento meio rob√≥tico, onde os personagens se mexiam duro sem um movimento real. Mas enquanto o movimento era um problema, os gr√°ficos me impressionaram, antes de ganhar o jogo (porque ganhei no IndieGala) eu achei que o jogo iria ter um gr√°fico simples, por ser um jogo indie e barato, mas eu errei, o gr√°ficos s√£o muito bonitos.
Se voc√™ for um Achievement Hunter (Ca√ßador de conquistas) recomendo este jogo, j√° que conseguir todas as conquistas neste jogo n√£o √© uma tarefa dif√≠cil, uma das conquisatas mais dif√≠ceis √© a "Ho Ho Ho" onde voc√™ tem que fazer uma parte do jogo no natal, mas √© s√≥ mudar a data do seu sistema.
Enfim, a dublagem do jogo √© boa, os gr√°ficos s√£o bonitos e a dificuldade √© boa, ent√£o tenho que recomendar este jogo.

[b]Nota:[/b] 8/10

review: Estamos hablando de una aventura Grafica, la historia es lo que cuenta, esta misma es... interesante cuando mucho, la verdad es que nunca me interes√≥ demasiado, incluso se me hizo un poco vaga pues, aunque el juego se llame "Capitulo 1" no esperaba que fuera tan introductivo, pues, nunca sucedi√≥ nada que me tuviera al borde de mi silla, ni hubo ningun momneto relativamente resaltable, aun asi, doy voto positivo porque, espero los dem√°s capitulos, y por lo que parece, con la personalidad del Dr. (protagonista) ser√° interesante ver en que se mete, ademas el final es muy "Continuar√°" es por ello que, como juego no es muy entretenido, de hecho es bastante corto, si pueden ver la historia en internet es mucho mejor, pero tengo esperanzas en el segundo juego.

review:
First thing: you need to be italian or, at least, know italian language to appreciate this game!

The game in itself is not so bad: it's a classic point&click adventure and the gameplay is simple like the riddles. The best part  is the comic style of the cutscenes: the dialogues and acting voices are not quite good, but the plot is interesting and sufficiently developed, also because is based on the book "In God's Name" of David Yallop.
But, be aware, this is only the first episode and doesn't last very long!
So, it is good enough to play but buy it at low price

author: {'steamid': '76561198149122232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1423645342}
review:
[b]Ich habe das Spiel einmal in Ruhe durch gespielt und dabei die Erfolge gesammelt und ein zweites Mal noch, um den letzten TimeRun-Erfolg zu bekommen.[/b]

[u][b]Das Fazit dieses Mal vorne weg:[/b][/u]
[b]Zu empfehlen f√ºr alle Die-Hard Fans von Click&Point Adventures, aber auch f√ºr Erfolgesammler (perfektes Spiel).
Alle anderen verpassen hier rein gar nichts![/b]

Es ist nur der erste Teil einer Trilogie, bzw. Quadrologie, f√ºhlt sich aber an wie das erste Drittel eines einzelnes Spieles. 
Die Story entwickelt sich nur schleppend, ist aber recht erwachsen, es handelt rund um das Buch "Im Namen Gottes",
welches der eine oder andere auch bei sich zu Hause hat.

Die R√§tsel reichen von interessant bis 08/15 langweilig. Manchmal bei√üt man sich richtig in die Handlung hinein, um ein R√§tsel sp√§ter einfach schnell ins Walkthrough zu schauen, weil es einfach zu bl√∂d ist.

Zu wenig Orte werden besucht, gerade mal 10St√ºck, die viel zu klein sind und viel zu wenig hergeben. Es wird nichts von Rom und seiner Geschichte oder dem Vatikan selbst, bis auf ein paar Ausnahmen, erz√§hlt. Man kann sich selber keine Infos, Gimmicks oder Nebenaufgaben erspielen. Die Bilder geben einfach nichts weiter, bis auf Story relevantes, her.

Die Grafik ist ganz ok, mehr aber auch nicht. Die Figuren selber sind doch langweilig pr√§sentiert, animiert.

Die gr√∂√üte St√§rke des Spiels liegt meiner Meinung nach in den Dialogen in Verbindung mit den R√§tseln, in denen man mit Hilfe der B√ºcher, bzw. Tageb√ºcher wirklich mitgenommen wird. Leider passiert das viel zu wenig. Nach spannenden 15min. folgen wieder 15min. "normales" Click&Point. Trotzdem machen die englischen Sprecher ihre Sache recht gut und der deutsche Text l√§√üt sich fl√ºssig mitlesen. Eine Prise Humor ist auch immer dabei. Der Hauptcharakter bleibt immer ein normaler Mensch, so dass man sich mit seinem Helden doch verbunden f√ºhlt. 

Unterm Strich ist es zu kurz und richtig Spannung kommt erst am Ende auf, und das ist dann auch der Cliffhanger.
K√∂nnte man gleich den zweiten Teil auf Steam hinter her spielen...aber so bleibt ein fader Nachgeschmack.

Die Erfolge sind einfach zu erreichen, auch ein perfektes Spiel, und Karten gibt es auch.
Alles bis 2Euro ist ein fairer Preis. F√ºr 6Euro greifen wohl nur die Allesspieler zu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175455899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1423630227}
review: This was gifted to me as an extra bundle key so I didnt pay fo rit.  I played it just for the cards because I found it boring counterintuitive and plain annoying. The walk cycle is poor and takes away from the immersion. The story was decent but not enough to be memorable. It can be confusing as to what to do, for instance in some situations where logic tells you to do something but the game wont allow it. Some of the voicing is good while some others are quiet bad. Overall I do not reccomend this game unless at 90% off or higher...better yet free in a bundle!

author: {'steamid': '76561198104488791', 'num_games_owned': 1925, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1423425992}
review:
Gra jest bardzo dobra pod wzglƒôdem fabularnym, z przyjemno≈õciƒÖ odkrywa≈Çem kolejne tajemnice na kt√≥re trafia≈Ç James. author: {'steamid': '76561198020738450', 'num_games_owned': 1088, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1423298290}
review:
Hmm, this is my 1st time to play a point-and-click adventure game and I can say it is somewhat good enough to be played by others, too. The story is nice, though it isn't that rich. The graphics and animation is bad, especially for HD but the gameplay is ok. Overall 6/10

Go ahead and play this game. Now I'm waiting for the next chapter...

Edit: Additional comment

What I dislike from the achievements is the "Dialogue Skipper". I really don't like it because you are encouraging people just to skim or even skip it at all and not get interested with the story. I earned this achievement on a 2nd run but I had a friend who just skipped it all on her 1st try.

What devs should encourage is for the gamers to have a lot of playing time on their game so they would recommend it to others and not just do it for the cards and uninstalling it afterwards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076826717', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1423310189}
review:
I never heard about this game until a few days back when it was available as a free Steam key... The story is good, backgrounds look nice, but the characters are a bit "boxy", and the animations are not that fluid all the time. But since this is an adventure game, the story and the interactions are what matters.

The interface is nice and clean, highlighting hotspots is a nice bonus for everyone that doesn't like to pixel hunt and the overall storytelling is great. Voice actors did an awesome job so the voiceovers are superb. Can't wait for Act II and see how it ends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021009654', 'num_games_owned': 2452, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1422980665}
review:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Spiel: 

Ein Point & Click Adventure Krimi, mit ausbaubarer aber sicherlich vorhersehbarer Geschichte und netten Charakteren.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Einzelspieler:

Man spielt einen Ex-Priester der seinen Freund helfen will, der aber Freund ist aber in eine gro√üe Verschw√∂rung herein geraten und ihr m√ºsst es aufdecken. Man sucht Items die man teilweise Kombinieren muss und man kann die Welt frei begehen wenn man die Stadtteile nach und nach freispielt. Die R√§tsel sind gut gemacht und auch manchmal etwas knifflig aber auch manchmal etwas schwer zu finden (in einem Buch bestimmte W√∂rter raussuchen). Leider gibt es keine richtigen Zwischen Sequenzen, sondern nur leicht animierte Bilder. Der Untertitel ist auch gut √ºbersetzt denke ich mal, keine Rechtschreibfehler oder komisch √ºbersetzte S√§tze.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grafik:

Grafisch ist das Spiel nicht besonders gut, hoch aufgel√∂st ist es zwar aber die Charaktermodelle sind nicht gerade die sch√∂nsten und sehen nur √§hnlich den Bildern der Gezeichneten.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Musik:

Die Musik ist ganz gut, auch die Sprachausgabe ist gut gelungen (leider nur in Englisch). Dennoch ist die Ton Lautst√§rke zwischen Normalen spielen und Zwischen Sequenzen zu unterschiedlich.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Steuerung:

Die ist gut gemacht konnte nicht mekkern. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pro/Contra:

+ gute Synchro (nur Englisch)
+ nette Geschichte
- manchmal Bugs sodass man neu laden musste 
- manche R√§tsel zu schwer zu finden
- zu teuer f√ºr nur einen Part

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Fazit:

Es ist sicherlich kein schlechtes Spiel aber wie teuer soll das Spiel werden wenn man z.B. 5 Teile rauskommen (1 Part a 5,99 bei 5 Parts sind das 29,95‚Ç¨)? Die Geschichte macht einen Soliden Eindruck, aber wirkt trotzdem erstmal sehr gewaltig. Wer, wo mit drin h√§ngt ist meistens gleich klar das die Charaktere von ihrem verhalten gleich drauf schliessen lassen. Leider macht die Grafik viel kaputt und richtiger Charme kommt auch nicht r√ºber so wie bei Jack Orlando. Also kaufen w√ºrde ich das Spiel nie in Parts da ich ja nicht weis ob es weitergehen wird, ich kann jedem nur Raten abwarten bis alles draussen ist zu einen fairen Preis (f√ºr alle Parts zusammen 3-6‚Ç¨) oder Finger weg.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Zusammengefasst: 

Einzelspieler: 6/10
Grafik: 4/10
Musik: 5/10
Steuerung: 8/10
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Spiel: 6/10
developer_response:
The series will be in 4 Acts (Act 2 will happen in a month). We're working on some technical / audio issues and we're gonna release a first update in a couple of days. Probably we're sell next Acts in a sort of 'bundle' at a cheaper price.

I'm sorry to see a thumb down on your review, because a 6/10 should still be a positive review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023203791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1423225218}
review: This game has interesting story but some dialogues and situations are illogical. The graphics a little bit suc* but as I said the story is a thing that's is worth to play this game. It's a good adventure game especially when I got it for free. But the current price is really upsetting because the games is too short. I completed it without 3 hours for the first time. To get a "Dialogue skipper" achievement it took to me about 40 mins. However, I recommend to try this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088339929', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1527250175}
review: My name is James Murphy. I'm 30 years old. My house is in the northeast section of Italy, where all the restaurants are, and I am not married. I worked as a doctor for Bluffton Hospital, and I used to get home every day by 8PM at the latest. I don't smoke, but I occasionally drink. I'm in bed by 11 PM, and make sure I get 8 hours of sleep, no matter what. After having a warm milk and doing about twenty minutes of stretches before going to bed,I usually have no problems sleeping until morning.Just like a baby, I wake up without any fatigue or stress in the morning. I was told there were no issues on my last check-up. Now I live in an apartment in Italy and i'm trying to explain that I'm a person who wishes to live a very quiet life. I take care not to trouble myself with any detectives cases, like thinking and resolving them, that would cause me to lose sleep at night.That is how I deal with society, and I know that is what bring me happiness. Although, if I were to be working on any detective case I wouldn't get assaulted by an assassin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095533842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1414801310}
review: Shadows on the Vatican offers a good story seasoned with fun conversations that shadows the poor character animations. You can check my more detailed[url=http://barancezayirli.com/2014/11/game-review-shadows-vatican-act-1-greed/] review [/url] on my blog.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018885004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1424648723}
review: This is an underestimated adventure: it has got many of the classic elements you can enjoy, interesting characters, an intriguing original plot, which is not a carbon copy of many others, and a lot of very good dialogue. This is only the set up for the whole story: Act II is even better.

review: Gra Shadows on the Vatican Act I: Greed zosta≈Ça wyprodukowana przez studio 10th Art, wydana zosta≈Ça natomiast 13 lutego 2012 roku. Fabu≈Ça gry opiera siƒô na tym, ≈ºe do g≈Çownego bohatera dzwoni przyjaciel, kt√≥rego zna z seminarium. Znajomy jest w powa≈ºnych tarapatach i twierdzi, ≈ºe tylko James mo≈ºe mu pom√≥c. Jednym z minus√≥w gry jest problem z uruchomieniem polskiej wersji jƒôzykowej. Sporo siƒô natrudzi≈Çem aby w og√≥le odpaliƒá grƒô. Musia≈Çem zmieniƒá jƒôzyk na Angielski i wtedy by≈Ço ok. Grafika jest w porzƒÖdku, biorƒÖc pod uwagƒô i≈º jest to gra 2D. Shadows on the Vatican Act I: Greed obs≈Çuguje tak≈ºe rozdzielczo≈õƒá full hd (1920x1080). Muzyka w grze jest dobra, za wyjƒÖtkiem tej z menu, kt√≥rƒÖ nawet jak ≈õciszymy to po ponownym odpaleniu gry bƒôdziemy s≈Çyszeƒá jƒÖ w maksymalnej g≈Ço≈õno≈õci. CiekawostkƒÖ jest ≈ºe dyrektorem artystycznym projektu by≈Ç Lorenzo Ruggiero - uznany rysownik, kt√≥ry ma na koncie wsp√≥≈Çpracƒô z takimi gigantami komiksowego ≈õwiata jak Marvel Comics i DC Comics. author: {'steamid': '76561198038106467', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1545381134}
review: Un gioco di produzione tutta italiana che riprende le tradizionali caratteristiche delle aventure grafiche punta e clicca, scegliendo tuttavia un approccio grafico non convenzionale ma di gran effetto accostando ai tradizionali fondali 2d ben disegnati delle cutscene comic-style della massima qualit√† della scuola fummetistica italica. Il doppiaggio √® fenomenale sopratutto nel dare spessore aii personaggi pi√π caratteristici del panorama romano. Perch√® si, la vicenda si svolge a Roma, in luoghi reali e visitabili, molto ben riprodotti. Il soggetto √® un indagine, svolta dal dott.James che si ritrova coinvolto (suo malgrado) in un indagine che vede collegati deliquenti della capitale, pezzi grossi della finanza e forse perfino il Vaticano in affari sporchi di grande portata; talmente grande che per James la posta in gioco, finisce per essere la sua vita... Aspettatevi per ci√≤ dialoghi da interrogatorio, analisi e raccolta di prove e insomma tutto il meglio di un buon thriller in cui la vostra pistola √® il vostro mouse!

review:
[h1]Shadows on the Vatican Act I [/h1] ist ein thematisch [b]relig√∂ses und geld-macht-politisch angehauchtes Point&Click.[/b] 

[table]
    [tr]
        [th]+[/th]

    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]1) charakteristischer Zeichenstil in Figuren und Zwischenszenen[/td]
        [td]1) ungelenke Animationen und unansehnliche Umgebungsgestaltung[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]2) ein paar lustige Dialoge, charakterbasierte Eigenheiten in den Dialogen[/td]
        [td]2) Untertitel passen nicht in die Sprechblasen, sind teilweise unvollst√§ndig[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]3) Englische Sprachausgabe (einfaches Englisch)[/td]
        [td]3) Geschichte war f√ºr mich nicht motivierend das Spiel weiter zu spielen, besonders die Sterotypen Antworten    der Hauptperson des Ex-Pristers[/td]
    [/tr]
  [tr]
        [td]4) Nette R√§tsel, Autoverfolgungsjagt durch die Stadt oder Buch-Heiligen-R√§tsel (Geheimbotschaft finden) [/td]
        [td]4)Vergleichsweise zu lange Ladezeiten besonders bei fortgeschrittenen Spielverlauf [/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

Ich denke der [b]Zeichenstil hat viel Potenzial[/b] durch seine starken Charistika. Das [b]Spiel hingegen hat weit weniger Potential.[/b] Ich pers√∂nlich w√ºrde eher Point&Clicks empfehlen wie[i] "Awakening - Der Wald der Roten Bl√§tter" oder "Das Haus am See".[/i] Beide haben forschende Elemente. Allerdings sind sie nicht so stark [b]detektivisch[/b] ausgepr√§gt wie in Shadows on the Vatican und ich denke, dies ist auch eins der gr√∂√üten Merkmale des Spieles. Auf diesen Punkt und den Zeichenstil solle aufgebaut werden in den folgenden Akten meiner Meinung nach. Ich hingegen werde die Reihe nicht weiter verfolgen.
developer_response:
Thanks for your review. May I ask some questions?

1) What version did you played (SD or HD)?
2) German version?
3) Could you tell some details about the subitltes/balloon issue? Did you remember some bugged sentences so we can fix those?

author: {'steamid': '76561198000132357', 'num_games_owned': 1173, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1423789647}
review:
Unos gr√°ficos buenos, una banda sonora genial y algunos di√°logos desternillantes...

como la mayor√≠a de las aventuras gr√°ficas "indis" que entregan por fasciculos (nada nuevo para la gente con mas de 30 a√±os que lleve jugando aventuras gr√°ficas desde los tiempos del MS-Dos) se hace muy corta pero gracias a los logros de steam que te "presionan" para volver a jugarla y conseguir sacarlos se alarga algo mas y es de agradecer.

lo que mas me a gustado de esta aventura y espero que en las pr√≥ximas entregas lo potencien mas ya que creo que es algo en lo que siempre fallan las aventuras gr√°ficas es que les da a algunos utensilios mas de un uso durante la aventura y sobre todo que algunos "puzzles" pueden solucionarse de mas de una manera.

lo que menos?? pues lo cl√°sico tambi√©n no?? esos "puzzles" que al final resuelves probando todas las combinaciones de objetos por que no sabes como avanzar e incluso despu√©s de resolverlo sigues sin entender su l√≥gica




PD/ esto de que algunos logros al parecer solo se puedan sacar en una fecha determinada..... :(

review: Tras terminalo , el juego en historia esta bastante bien el principio es flojo pero luego llega engancharte , los puzzles y rompecabezas estan en un nivel intermedio , graficamente para ser del 2014 es bastante decepcionante , la jugabilidad es como la de cualquier aventura grafica , lo que buscaba en el juego me lo a dado que a sido entretenerme y una historia buena con algunos puntos de humos y de verdad sobre la iglesia y lo que hacen con el dinero.

review:
Point & Click  ist nicht mein Spielgenre, trotzdem bin ich dankbar wenn ich Spiele kostenlos bekomme. 
Mein erstes kostenloses Point & Click war leider nur in Englisch verf√ºgbar, somit unspielbar f√ºr mich. Und jetzt habe ich dieses hier bekommen. Positiv ist aufjdenfall  das es deutsche Untertitel gibt, somit kann ich dem Spiel wenigstens eine Chance geben. Negativ fiel mir leider sofort die Grafik und die schlechten Animationen auf. Aber ich war bereit mich darauf einzulassen, weil ja Grafik bekanntlich nicht alles ist. Nur dann bin ich einem Bug begegnet, der mich am weiterspielen hindert (Szene mit der Nonne , kann den Raum nicht verlassen). Ich habe 2 mal von vorne angefangen, neugestartet, alles angeklickt, kombiniert, Komplettl√∂sungen durchgelesen und Lets Plays angeguckt. Aber nichts half. Somit ist auch dieses Point & Click Game leider unspielbar f√ºr mich. Andere berichten noch von mehr Bugs und kurze Spielzeit.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984658225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1404857259}
review:
Dieses Spiel ist der erste Akt einer Spielserie rund um den Vatikan.
Man spielt einen Ex-Priester den ein Freund um Hilfe bittet. Schon ist man mittendrin im Geschehen.
Alles in allem ein Standard Point&Click Adventure.
Die R√§tsel sind meiner Meinung nach OK.
Die Hintergr√ºnde ganz gut gezeichnet, jedoch gefallen mir die Figurenmodelle nicht so gut.
Von der Spieldauer her sehr kurz, liegt aber daran das es nur der Erste Akt ist.
Kann das Spiel empfehlen, aber ich selbst w√ºrde nur kaufen, wenn es im Angebot ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002977309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1406998830}
review:
Shadows on the Vatican Atto I: Avarizia √® un titolo che far√† piacere ai fan delle avventure grafiche vecchio stampo che, nonostante la sua estrema brevit√†, riesce a tenere incollati a mouse e tastiera per tutta la sua durata grazie a una trama intrigante e priva di cali. Sicuramente non √® un titolo per tutti.

**English**

author: {'steamid': '76561198021380094', 'num_games_owned': 389, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1421369451}
review:
Consigliato solo a chi vuole avvicinarsi a un'avventura grafica senza star li a impazzire sugli enigmi . Penso sia il punta e clicca pi√π facile che ricordo di aver finito .Dura pochissimo , diviso in due parti ,e una trama intrigante ma non troppo .
Se siete dei gomblottisti e ricercate storie sulle caste del vaticano e cose cos√¨ vi piacer√† di sicuro .
Che si tratti di un gioco con budget molto basso (almeno spero ) , lo si capisce da una scialba grafica , animazioni abbozzate,e un doppiaggio che va tra l'osceno e il divertente. 
Cio√® era dai tempi dei classici della Lucas che non vedevo voci in un pizzicato romanesco ,cos√¨ caratteristiche.
Per 6 euro vale la pena prenderlo a patto che poi giochiate anche il secondo ,visto che sul punto pi√π bello finisce.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031651888', 'num_games_owned': 798, 'num_reviews': 441, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1420655552}
review:
Shadows on the Vatican est un thriller passionnant. Du moins, l'acte 1 m'a donn√© l'eau √† la bouche : je veux la suite ! Vite ! 

Les √©nigmes sont int√©ressantes, certaines sont d'ailleurs assez originales (j'ai beaucoup aim√© celle du livre et des images de saints). Elles forcent √† √™tre attentif et √† r√©fl√©chir, sans simplement faire de mani√®re fr√©n√©tique toutes les combinaisons d'objets.

Les dessins des personnages lors des dialogues sont bien faits, ainsi que les cin√©matiques qui font penser √† une bande-dessin√©e.

Par contre, il y a beaucoup de petits hics qui viennent g√¢cher l'exp√©rience de jeu :
- la mod√©lisation des personnages catastrophique : le h√©ros est raide comme un piquet avec une expression de visage abominable
- lorsqu'un objet ne peut pas √™tre utilis√© sur un autre √©l√©ment, une simple croix  rouge interdit l'action. Dommage... √ßa rend la r√©solution d'√©nigmes √† base d'objets trop facile.
- dommage que le jeu ne nous laisse pas la main sur les recherches d'ordinateur (comme dans un "blackwell") : assez de nous prendre par la main !
- la course poursuite en voiture est p√©nible, ou alors j'ai loup√© un truc...

Mais malgr√© ces d√©fauts, j'ach√®terai la suite ne serait-ce que pour le sc√©nario tr√®s prometteur.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058687420', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1418579941}
review:
This is a nice little point & click: standard in many ways, but with rather interesting characters, occasionally entertaining dialogs and mostly enjoyable puzzles. The priest-detective concept (fine, ex-priest) is a novel enough idea in games, one I last enjoyed with the Shiva's rabbi. And sure, concpiracies centering around the Vatican are a dime a dozen, but the Italian background of the devs shows in the way they manage to be at the same time respectful and irreverent, making a commonplace story feel refreshing. The story starts slowly but does a nice job of drawing you in, ending (predictably) with a cliffhanger, but one that made me interested in the episodes to come. 

The writing mainly benefits from having small moments of actual brilliance in characterization, creating unexpectedly endearing portraits of both the hero and many the people you meet, that very much drive the storytelling. And since this is supposed to be the prologue in a 4 part series, there is alot of lovingly crafted character introduction to be had and enjoyed. In fact I have the feeling that it was the memorable characters (and therefore their story) and some decent pacing that caused me to mostly forget there were puzzles there. That, and the fact that they were mostly easy and logical, and that important information was always pointed out to you, more or less inobtrusively. 

Some more general stuff: The backgrounds are nicely made, the animation a bit less so but not jarring. I enjoyed the music very much, though the voice acting can be hit and miss. I also had no bugs or technical problems, which I appreciated (since the first time I tried to play the DRM free version a while back I had serious issues - glad to see them fixed). And yes, the game is rather short, which personally doesn't bother me for the price.

All in all, I was surprised by this one, and will look forward to the next act. It isn't perfect or particularly unique, but it is memorable and endearing, and I very much had fun with it while it lasted.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973059038', 'num_games_owned': 2548, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1965, 'last_played': 1420098887}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062269122', 'num_games_owned': 1154, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1413354510}
review:
A m√≠, todo el rollo que tiene que ver con iglesia, religi√≥n, santos y dem√°s historias para no dormir me aburre tanto que soy capaz de entrar en coma. Creo que es de las cosas m√°s prescindibles del planeta, incluso por delante de Phill Collins en su etapa en solitario. A pesar de ello, yo que tiendo a acumular, me hice con esta aventura gr√°fica, la cual te venden como el primer cap√≠tulo de una historia de, como no pod√≠a ser de otra manera, intrigas eclesiales en italia. El protagonista es un excura, supongo que porque poner un cura "full equipe" tendr√≠a un t√°rget m√°s reducido (mola decir "t√°rget" en una frase, ¬øeh?) porque a la mayor√≠a de gente se la pelan los curas y le aburre su modo de vida. ¬øC√≥mo se iba a desenvolver un cura en una trama peligrosa? ¬øRezando? ¬øLanzando biblias?
La historia es bastante floja. Perfectamente podr√≠an anunciar el juego con la frase "¬°De los guionistas de los bodrios de s√°bado tarde en Antena 3!".
La est√©tica me recuerda a la de c√≥mic, y los escenarios no est√°n mal. Lo que s√≠ est√° fatal es el movimiento ortop√©dico de los personajes. Tan malo es y tan mal lo han querido disimular, que cuando tienen que usar un objeto, el personaje se pone de espaldas y lo ves "hacer algo", de manera que el animador no tiene que currarse una animaci√≥n medianamente complicada. De hecho, hay un momento en que el personaje hace como que se saca del bolsillo un libro m√°s grande que su cabeza. Jajajajaja... Pat√©tico. En un juego de cachondeo, vale, pero en √©ste que parece ir de suspense queda cutre.
Otra fallo son los tiempos de carga. Cuando abres el juego, una m√∫sica m√°s fuerte de lo normal  te avisa que est√°s en el men√∫ del juego. Como le des a "Cargar partida" te da tiempo a ir a Mercadona un s√°bado a las 2 de la tarde, comprar, hacer la cola en la caja, volver a casa, ordenar la compra, volver a la nevera horas despu√©s y comprobar que las cervezas est√°n fr√≠as, beb√©rtelas todas, ya que est√°s, te bebes una botella de vino, te quedas dormido, te despiertas resacoso, te tomas un caf√© que excede en 200 veces la dosis de cafe√≠na recomendada para un ser humano, y si no te entretienes mucho con el caf√©, llegas justo a tiempo cuando la partida termina de cargar.
Este primer cap√≠tulo no es que sea la aventura m√°s corta que he jugado, pero en media tarde te lo puedes terminar si no te enredas mucho. A pesar de la anodina historia, se deja jugar. Podr√≠a rozar el aprobado raspado, pero los fallos puntuales que tiene lo arrastran al suspenso. No quiero ser aguafiestas. Tiene margen de mejora. Habr√° que ver el segundo cap√≠tulo si mejora, pero desde luego, el comienzo es flojo. T√≠pica aventura que olvidar√°s muy pronto.

[b]¬øC√≥mo se hace un caf√© de esos de los que hablas?[/b] La CIA me ha prohibido hablar de ello.
[b]El juego ser√° malo, pero que salgan curas y dem√°s no quita que pueda ser bueno un juego.[/b] Es posible, pero hasta ahora nadie lo ha conseguido PORQUE TODO ESE ROLLO CURETA ES ESO. UN ROLLO.
[b]Vaaaaaaleeeeee...[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198022820771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1408962578}
review:
http://youtu.be/8vAYIDHDSW0?list=UU7_-PLIhjsEBwIQXqKxmNpA
Shadows on the Vatican Act 1, is an adventure/detective game, set in
a modern-esque world.  You play the part of an ex-priest called in to
solve a mystery that surrounds the church and the Vatican.

The tutorial does a good job of showing you how to play, while 
remaining integrated into the story.  The voice acting was mostly 
performed in a professional manner, and the art style was good, but the animations
of the characters were robotic and doll-like. 

As a detective game, it did a poor job of drawing you to the next clue, 
instead forcing you to look for the smallest of objects.  This coupled with being unable to make leaps in logic, instead being forced to complete every task, 
in order, made it rather frustrating.

As I said before, the main character is a former priest who takes on 
the role of detective.  Sometimes the writing tries to justify
religious arguments logically without taking into account that the
main character is currently in conflict with his religious beliefs,
making it seem somewhat forced, and more difficult to connect with 
him due to how he responds to people in the world.

In the adventure part, I know why I am here, what I am doing, where I am going, and who I am talking with. As well as having the information on my back story and small to large info on the back story of supporting characters. It gives you the information you need to progress with out feeling like you do not understand what is going on around you. 

Unfortunately the flaws of this game outweighed it's good points, 
making me unable to recommend it.

The video offers a much deeper in look as this is a brief summary. 
Thanks for your viewership and support for more videos check click here. 

http://www.youtube.com/user/SocioPyscho

author: {'steamid': '76561198079501054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1406906527}
review:
Had some hopes for this game, just finished it and I'm really disappointed: you can find much better graphic adventures (you probably will if you pick blindly from a random list). 

Voice acting is terrible and overdramatic and the conversations are rather uninteresting 90% of the time, which is pretty annoying (they feel just like fillers to make the game longer). Graphics are nothing to call home about - passable (I guess?), controls are just fine (usual point & click adventure with some pixel-hunting but not too much).

The plot is not well set up: after finishing Act I you should AT LEAST have an idea on how good the story's going to be - but barely anything happens, I understand that they cannot unveil too much on the first act but it's just too vague. At this point I have no idea if the story is going to be amazing or a boring, run-of-the-mill, Da Vinci Code-esque type of thing. Pretty bland.

Creativity = 0. If you're a fan of graphic adventure games, all you will do in this game are things you have already done hundreds of times in other mediocre adventures. Things of this sort: find key, use key in the next 2 minutes, get a damp X to clean X, use computer to look up Y information, show item you just found to person Z who is right next to it. There are barely any puzzles too. Nothing to see here.

It's really short even for an episode-based game. 2,5 hours and I took my time. Again, not really anything substantial.

I won't be purchasing the following acts unless they come in a bundle or are ridiculously cheap at some point. Maybe not even then.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098229889', 'num_games_owned': 5344, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1406824373}
review:
Bastante recomendable, la verdad.

Se juega en un par de horas pero eso no le quita encanto, me recuerda mucho a Cognition en cuanto a desarrollo pero salvando las distancias de que √©ste es mucho m√°s modesto. Alguna que otra vez he sufrido con los avances (como en todas las aventuras gr√°ficas) pero se puede sacar, la historia es bastante intuitiva y eso se agradece.

Espero que saquen las otras 3 partes en Steam porque no dudar√© en irlas pillando, la historia queda abierta y de una manera bastante interesante. Si te gustan las aventuras gr√°ficas deber√≠as echarle un ojo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067688484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1406603811}
review:
A good entry point in to the four-part point-and-click religious thriller, but a bit of a slow burn. Once it picks up, it's over, but it does manage to introduce memorable characters and provide quality hand-drawn cut-scenes. The soundtrack is also a huge plus. Voice acting is hit or miss. It's also pretty linear, as the main character will always tell you if an item or a doorway is worth investigating; which kind of took the "adventure" out of adventure game. More or less exactly what you'd expect from an episodic first act.

(Full review - 6.5/10)
http://whatsyourtagblog.com/2014/07/29/shadows-on-the-vatican-act-1-greed-review/

review:
Avventura punta-e-clicca in stile fumetto con una storia avvincente.
Il problema √® che si tratta solo di mezza avventura: se non si prende anche l'Atto II la storia rimane sospesa per cui √® consigliata solo se si √® in previsione di prendere anche il seguito.
Gioca a suo favore il basso costo ma giustifica solo in parte la brusca interruzione con cui finisce questo atto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018759539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1404061286}
review: I really can not recommend this game to anyone. It's unfortunately pretty bad. The voice acting is terrible (Especially the character of Silvia), the puzzle logic is sometimes pretty strange. Maybe I'm just dumb but a few times I found myself having to just randomly try items on various objects to continue. And worst of all the plot is pretty nothing. I get that it's an episode 1, so it's mostly setup. But I would have liked for something to happen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031856776', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1404284286}
review:
Cuando uno se encuentra con aventuras gr√°ficas Indies, tiene que tener cuidado a la hora de comprar, porque muchas veces terminando siendo una desgracia y una p√©rdida de dinero.
Pero le ech√© unas fichas a √©sta aventura gr√°fica y la verdad es que no me decepcion√≥ para nada.

Si bien el motor gr√°fico no es una maravilla, tampoco pretende ser lo que no es y no nos vende nada que no quiere ser. Eso es lo principal de este juego, no aparenta ser lo que no es. Desde el principio se muestra tal cual es y eso es lo que me gust√≥.

La Historia Gira en torno a James, un ex cl√©rigo que por una crisis de fe deja la iglesia y se vuelve a su pa√≠s natal, USA. Pero luego de recibir una llamada de un viejo amigo suyo, Crist√≥foro, vuelve presuroso a Roma solo para descubrir que algo siniestro est√° pasando y el vaticano, o est√° involucrado o hace la vista gorda.

El juego tiene algunos puzzles interesantes que quiza te partiran un poco la cabeza, dialogos divertidos, personajes simp√°ticos y bien dise√±ados, y un toque de humor que le dan una atm√≥sfera divertida. A eso hay que sumarle los dibujos "estilo comic" que hay en los dialogos y en ciertas secuencias (parecidas en cierta manera a lo que hay en The Wolf Among Us) que le dan un toque de belleza al arte.

El primer capitulo es cortito, se pasa en unas horas si se sacan rapido los puzzles, pero deja un buen sabor y ganas de jugar los capitulos siguientes y ver que pasa.
tambien a los complesionistas (como yo) los logros de steam son divertidos y a los que les guste leer tienen mucho de la historia del clero y de los papas y los santos si son curiosos.

Un buen juego para darle aire fresca a las aventuras gr√°ficas en tercera persona de point & Click que andan faltando en estos dias.

Demasiado corta, y pocos lugares a visitar de momento, pero solo es el acto I. Ya est√°n el 2 y el 3 en su p√°gina, esperemos tenerlos pronto por aqu√≠.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065426173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1403120680}
review:
Summary: A lackluster point and click adventure with standard puzzles.  Recommended for fans of the genre only. 

Pros:
Good backround music.
Backdrops and cut scenes are well done. 
Interesting plot.

Cons: 
I found the voice acting poor. 
Character animation is poor. 

Would I buy episode 2? Yes but I would hope for an improvement.
